loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Daniel has operated a cereal shop for over ten years, selling to his neighbours. He faces a major business challenge of seasonality. He hopes to establish a big cereal shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans and cow peas for sale. He decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize, beans, and cow peas to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia A., 47, is a micro entrepreneur who makes something big out of what is little. She did not even reach high school, but her life story does not simply end there. Patricia is married to Ricardo, a mason with regular work. Together they take care of their only child, a daughter, in their home in Baseco, Manila.

To cope with financial difficulties, Patricia has set up her own carinderia (food stall) located in Intramuros, Manila. Here, she cooks delicious meals for customers who find it easier to buy cooked food than to prepare their own, especially on busy days. Patricia has been running her carinderia for seven years. She is also buys and sell palay (rice grain). Her entrepreneurial efforts earn her Php11,000 per month.

To improve her carinderia, she decided to borrow Php30,000 with the help of CCT* to improve both her food business as well as her trading business. Aside from quality food ingredients, she also intends to buy palay and sell it to business connections. She plans to have small homes to rent to boarders. 

One struggle Patricia faces is family finances, as the price of the goods in the market has soared. But she knows she will overcome, because the Lord of her life is one faithful Provider. She desires to see the expansion of her business and allow her family to experience prosperity. Currently, she is saving up for her child’s education. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: purchasing palay (rice grain) to sell

loans.name: Punjik

texts.en:
Punjik G. lives in Tolors village of Sisian region, famous for its severely harsh climate conditions. In the winter it is extremely cold, and in the summer it is very hot. The land in Sisian is suitable for growing only a few agricultural products.

Punjik lives with her daughter and son. She works in the local school as a cleaning lady, receiving an extremely low salary,  impossible for the family to survive on. Being a good lender in the past, Punjik has again applied to SEF International for a loan, planning to plant wheat seed, which will bring her additional income.

loans.use: buying wheat seed

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with one child who attends school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a green vegetable stall business, selling from his home to neighbours and passers-by. In addition he also sells beans and rice, which provide additional income. Peter faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to open a cereals shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, rice, and vegetables. He decided to join Yehu to access loans and get training on various businesses to invest in.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes, rice, and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand business and make shop larger

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Né le 09 Août 1978 à N’Golo-Diassa situé à environ 6km de la ville de Sikasso, Monsieur Moussa B. marié et père de deux garçons, il réside avec sa femme et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie  dans son village natal, ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur B. est un mécanicien de profession depuis plus de huit ans. 
Pour faciliter ses clients d’acquérir des pièces auto, il mène en parallèle à son métier, des activités d’achat et de vente de pièces détachées. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant deux ans avec laquelle il est à son quatrième prêt individuel. Ses prêts précédents ont été tous remboursés.
Il compte acheter avec ce  quatrième  prêt des pièces détachées à savoir des bielles, arbre à came, pistons, jantes, etc. Les marchandises (pièces) sont achetées sur places à travers le démontage des véhicules cass pour être vendues par pièces dans son magasin au sein de son garage.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on August 9, 1978 in N’Golo-Diassa, about 6 km from the city of Sikasso, Mr. Moussa B. is married and the father of two sons. He lives with his wife and children in a traditional extended family in his native village (in the third administrative region of Mali).

For over eight years, Mr. B. has been working as a car mechanic. In order to make it easier for his clients to obtain spare parts, he also purchases and sells spare parts. He is very much sought after by customers due to quality of his goods. In order to satisfy growing customer demand, two years ago he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. He has been a member for two years and is now on his fourth individual loan. The previous loans have all been repaid. He plans to use this fourth loan to purchase spare parts, such as connecting rods, camshaft, pistons, wheel rims, etc. The wares (spare parts) are purchased on the spot as the cars are being taken apart and then sold individually in his car repair shop.

With this loan, he plans to achieve an average monthly income of 95,000 West African francs, which will basically be used to cover everyday family expenses, pay off the interests on his loan, with the rest reinvested in his business.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts

loans.name: Mansa

texts.fr: Madame  Mansa  est âgée  de  40 ans  et  a un enfant à charge.  Pour améliorer les conditions de  vie  de son  enfant, elle fait  le  commerce  de  produits d’alimentation générale.  Elle a commencé en  2009 et s’approvisionne  au  grand marché  de Lomé.   Elle  revend  les  produits sur la route La pampa à adidogomé. Elle  sollicite  un  prêt  pour acheter  12 cartons  de  tomates,   5 bidons  d’huile et  4  cartons  de  spaghettis.
texts.en: Ms. Mansa is 40 years old and has a dependent child. In order to improve her child’s life conditions, she sells general food products. She launched this business in 2009 and stocks up at the big market of Lomé. She resells her goods along the La Pampa route in Adidogomé. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase 12 boxes of tomatoes, five jugs of oil and four boxes of spaghetti.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr:
Âgé de plus de  33 ans, Monsieur  Dramane K. est marié et père de 3 enfants (1 garçon et 2 filles), il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Dramane K.  après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès,  s’est initié, il y a environ quatre ans, à cette activité d’achat et de vente de bazins blancs, soude caustique, teintures, etc. Il mène son activité à Wayerma I en face de l’Agence Malienne pour la Presse et la Publicité (AMAP) de Sikasso, non loin de la prison centrale où il dispose d’une boutique. Monsieur K. est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  il y a trois ans et avec qui  il est à son quatrième prêt individuel. Ses prêts précédents ont été tous correctement remboursés.
Ce  nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 25 paquets de soude caustique, 15 pièces de bazin, 10 sacs de potasse, 15 boîtes de teintures de couleurs différentes, etc. Ses marchandises sont achetées à Bamako pour  ensuite être revendues à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes teinturières de Sikasso.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce présent prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt
texts.en:
Mr. Dramane K. is over 33 years old and married with three children (a boy and two girls). He lives with his wife and their children in a large traditional family in Wayerma I, a popular district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having attempted many occupations without success, Dramane K. leaned the business of buying and selling white damask, caustic soda, dyes, etc. approximately four years ago. He conducts his business in Wayerma I in front of the Malian Press and Publicity Agency of Sikasso, not far from the central prison where he has a shop. Mr. K.'s products are in high demand due to their high quality.

In order to better serve an increasing customer base, he decided three years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with whom he is now on his fourth individual loan. Previous loans have all been repaid in full. 

This new loan will allow him to buy 25 packets of caustic soda, 15 pieces of damask, 10 bags of potash, 15 boxes of dye in different colors, etc.  He buys his stocks in Bamako and sells the merchandise to a clientele composed mainly of women dyers from Sikasso.

With this loan, he expects to earn a monthly profit of 250,000 FCFA which will be used primarily to increase his working capital, help with the family expenses. and pay the interest on the loan.

loans.use: To buy white damask, caustic soda, dyes, potash, etc.

loans.name: Kadidia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadidia B. a plus de 30 ans, mariée et mère de deux fillettes, vivant avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I-Kapel Kourou, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Kadidia B. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et  de vente d’huile alimentaire, de couscous arabe,  de cube maggie et bien d’autres divers  articles depuis plus de six années. Elle mène son activité à la maison et au marché de son quartier où elle dispose  d’une place. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  depuis plus de deux ans. Elle est actuellement à son 4ème prêt  dont les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
 Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 7 bidons d’huile alimentaire, 5 cartons de couscous arabe, 10 cartons de maggie, 3 cartons du thé Arawane et de stock de condiments. Elle  achète ses marchandises sur commande à Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso) et aussi dans les huileries de  la place avant de les revendre en détail au marché de leur localité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Kadidia B. is 30-something years old, married, and the mother of two little girls. She lives with her husband and their children in Sanoubougou I-Kapel Kourou, an outlying district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many business unsuccessfully, Kadidia became familiar with buying and selling cooking oil, Arab couscous, Maggie bouillon cubes, and many other types of goods. She has been in this business for over six years and runs it out of her house and at the market in her district, where she has a spot at her disposal. She is in high demand by her customers for the quality of her products.

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, Kadidia decided to join again the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso over two years ago. She is currently on her fourth loan. The previous ones have all been repaid. 

She intends to use her loan to buy:  7 containers of cooking oil, 5 boxes of Arab couscous, 10 boxes of Maggie bouillon cubes, 3 boxes of Arawane tea, and a supply of condiments. She buys her merchandise by special order in Bobo Dioulasso (Republic of Burkina Faso) and also from local oil mills, and then she sells them retail at the market in their town.

With this loan, Kadidia envision making a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially for helping with family expenses and paying the loan interest. The rest will be used for investing in her business.

loans.use: Buying condiments

loans.name: Polvondjon

texts.en: Polvondjon is 25 years old. He is a farmer growing vegetables, something he has done for 10 years. This is the only thing he knows how to do and what he likes most. For Polvondjon, there is nothing better than being in touch with nature and watching the crops of his labor grow year after year. Now he wants to borrow money for purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants in order to grow seasonal vegetables. Polvondjon has gained a reputation for responsibility with his financial obligations and for keeping his word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist him with the operation of his business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

She has operated a firewood business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also sells coconuts, which contributes to her other source of income. Mgeni faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for sale

loans.name: Aku Eunice

texts.fr: Madame  Eunice  est née à kévé. Elle est mariée avec 3  enfants  à  charge.  Elle a reçu déjà  deux crédits  qu’elle  a parfaitement  remboursés.  Elle fait le commerce de  produits  d’alimentation  et de céréales. Elle a débuté  en  2007 cette activité et  achète ces produits  au  grand  marché  de  Lomé.  Elle revend les produits dans une boutique  sur la route d’adidogomé.  Elle demande un prêt  pour  acheter  3 cartons de savons,  4 bidons d’huile, 40 bols  de maïs  et  40 bols d’haricot.
texts.en: Ms. Eunice was born in Kévé. She is married and has three children to support. She has already had three loans, which she repaid completely. Her business involves grocery items and grains.  She started it in 2007 and buys these goods at the main market of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She resells the goods in her shop located on the road to Adidogomé. She is asking for a loan for buying 3 boxes of soap, 4 containers of oil, 40 bowls of corn, and 40 bowls of beans.

loans.use: Buying supplies and grains

loans.name: Mahamadou

texts.fr:
Né le 23 Décembre 1985 à Sikasso ville, Monsieur Mahamadou  Diabaté est marié et père de 2 enfants (1 garçon et 1 fille), il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle avec ses parents et ses frères à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur D. après l’activité de boulanger sans succès, s’est initié il y a deux années à la vente de matelas en provenance de Bobo Dioulasso (du Burkina Faso). Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a une année.  Il a bénéficié d’un premier prêt qui fut correctement remboursé, ainsi il sollicite un deuxième afin d’augmenter son fonds de commerce.
Ce deuxième lui permettra ainsi d’acheter, 10 matelas d’épaisseurs 15, 5 matelas d’épaisseur 20 “deux places”, 8 matelas d’épaisseur 20 “trois places”, etc. Il est très sollicité surtout par les menuisiers-ébénistes de la ville. Ses matelas sont vendus en détail au comptant et souvent à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt
texts.en:
Born on December 1985 in the town of Sikasso, Mr. Mahamadou Diabaté is married and the father of two children (a boy and a girl). He lives with his wife and children in a traditional extended family, together with his parents and brothers in Sanobougou I, a peripheral district of the town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).

After unsuccessfully trying to work as a baker, two years ago Mr. Diabaté  launched a business selling mattresses in the area of Bobo Dioulasso in Burkina Faso. In order to meet the growing customer demand, a year ago he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution . His first loan duly repaid, he is now seeking a second loan in order to bolster his buinsess capital. This second loan will allow him to purchase ten 15-cm mattresses, five 20-cm “double” mattresses, eight 20-cm “triple” [queen size] mattresses etc. He is very sought after by the  local furniture makers. His mattresses are retailed for cash, and often on credit.

With this loan, he plans to achieve a monthly inome of 100,000 West African francs, which will basically be used to bolster his business capital, contribute to the family budget and pay off the interest on his loan.

loans.use: Purchasing mattresses

loans.name: Tchilalou

texts.fr: Madame  Tchilalou  a 33  ans  et mère d’un enfant.  Pour contribuer au ménage, elle exerce comme  activité  la vente de  céréales.    Elle compte dans cette activité  3 ans  et s’approvisionne à  Kpalimé  et  à Bassar.  Elle les revend  à la devanture  de  sa  maison à adidogomé. Elle sollicite un  prêt pour acheter  80 bols de maïs et  30 bols d’haricot.
texts.en: Ms. Tchilalou is 33 years old and the mother of one child. To help out at home, she has a business selling grains and has three years of experience in it. She gets her supplies in Kpalimé and in Bassar, and she sells the goods in front of her house in Adidogomé. She is requesting a loan for buying 80 bowls of corn and 30 bowls of beans.

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Âgée de 30 ans, Madame Mariam Traoré est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont 1 garçon et 1 fille. Il vit dans une famille nucléaire à Médine-Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée depuis plus de deux ans à cette activité de vente des condiments aliments tels les oignons, au nouveau de marché dont elle dispose table  et où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a une année. Elle est à son deuxième crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter, 13 sacs d’oignons de graines différentes (9 sacs de petites graines et 6 sacs de grosses graines) auprès d’une femme qui lui vend en gros au comptant  et à crédit.
Ses marchandises sont vendues au comptant à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes de ménage.
Avec ce deuxième crédit elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
With 30 years of age, Mariam Traoré is married and have two children, a boy and a girl. She lives in a nuclear family in Medina, Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). 
After running a few business activities without much success, over two years ago she started selling food condiments such as onions, a new market section where she has competence and her products are highly demanded for their quality. 
To face the increasing demand of her customers, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso a year ago. She is on her second loan that will enable her to improve her business in order and to buy 13 bags of onions of different seeds (a few bags of small seeds and a few of large seeds) from a wholesaler, who offers cash and credit payments. Her products are sold cash to a clientele composed mostly by housekeepers. 
With this second loan, she expects to earn an average monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA which will be used primarily to contribute to family expenses and pay interests on the loan while the rest will be invested in the business.

loans.use: Purchase of onions

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1961 à Niamana préfecture de Kolondièba (Région Sikasso),  Madame Safiatou B. est mariée et mère de cinq enfants, résidant  avec ses enfants chez son époux à Sanoubougou I-Kapel Kourou Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Safiatou B. après avoir avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initiée  depuis maintenant plus de dix ans à l’achat et à la vente de tubercules (Pomme de terre, patate, igname, etc). Elle vend ses articles à la gare routière de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée essentiellement de voyageurs mais aussi de transporteurs. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux ans. Ainsi elle a bénéficié d’un premier crédit qui a été correctement remboursé. Alors dans but de toujours mieux relancer ses activités, elle sollicite ce deuxième crédit lui permettant d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour pouvoir acheter, 15 caisses de pomme de terre, 10 sacs de patate et 10 sacs d’igname à Sikasso et environnants
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1961 in Niamana, prefecture of Kolondièba (region of Sikasso), Mrs. Safiatou B. is married and the mother of five children. She lives with her children and husband in Sanoubougou I-Kapel Kourou Sikasso (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After trying several businesses unsuccessfully, Madam Safiatou B. started buying and selling tubers (potatoes, sweet potatoes, yam etc.) 10 years ago. She sells her goods at the bus station in Sikasso to a customer-base mainly made up of travelers but also of carriers. She is very much sought after by her customers for the quality of her products. 

In order to meet the needs of her ever-increasing customer-base, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution approximately two years ago. She benefited from a first loan, which she successfully paid off.

With the goal of boosting her business, she is requesting this second loan that will allow her to increase her working capital and buy 15 cases of potatoes, 10 bags of sweet potatoes and 10 bags of yam in Sikasso and its outskirts.

With this loan, she intends to make a monthly profit of 100,000 CFA francs, which will be mainly used to increase her working capital, contribute to the family expenses and pay the interests of her loan.

loans.use: To purchase tubers

loans.name: Otamurot

texts.en: Otamurot J. is 52 years old. He is married and has one child. He sells cattle. As a rule, Otamurot purchases the small cattle in the central market, feeds them and than resells them at higher prices in the local market. Being in this business for 14 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and to generate a stable, considerable income for his large family. Otamurot is planning to enlarge the stock and to purchase more cattle. For this purpose, he requests 6,000 Somoni that he will spend for the purchase of young cattle and for feed for them. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more phone cards and add some cash to his foreign exchange business

loans.name: Lilian I's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at College Secondary School in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. The school was founded in September 1999 by the Eastern Polytechnic College Board of Governors to serve as a feeder school for the college. Currently, the school has 34 teachers on its pay roll and 965 registered pupils.

This is the first loan that the teachers of this school have requested from SMT & Kiva lenders. They have asked for SLL 12,400,000 for the entire group, and with the help of this loan, these teachers will be in a strong position to buy or invest in something that their salaries alone can not allow them to.

Lilian I. M., 52, is the leader of the group. She was born in a village called Kpetema. She is married and has 2 children; 1 is in secondary school and the other is no longer attending school. Lilian has been a teacher for 30 years now. She will invest her share of the loan in a business.

loans.use: to invest in a business

loans.name: Kokoè  Homefa

texts.fr: Dame Homefa est mariée et a un enfant.  Elle est née à Lomé et habite  vakpossito.  Elle  fait le commerce  de friperie  et compte déjà  10 ans dans cette  activité. Elle achète les habits au marché local de hedzranawoé et les  revend  au grand  marché de Lomé en face de la pharmacie  du  grand  marché.   Elle demande un prêt  pour acheter  2 balles d’habits pour  les enfants,  1  balle  d’habit dame  et  1 balle de pantalon.
texts.en: Ms. Homefa is married and has one child. She was born in Lomé, the capital of Togo, and lives in Vakpossito. Her work involves second-hand clothing, and she has ten years of experience in this business. She buys the clothes at the local market in Hedzranawoé and sell them at the main market of Lomé opposite the main market’s pharmacy. She is asking for a loan for buying 2 bales of children’s clothing, 1 bale of women’s clothing, and 1 bale of pants.

loans.use: Buying used clothing

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Âgée de plus 49 ans, Madame Safiatou D. réside dans une grande famille avec son époux et ses six enfants (1 garçon et 5 filles) à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Safiatou D. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité de fabrication de l’Attieke qu’elle a appris avec une voisine venue de la république de Côte d’Ivoire depuis plus de vingt ans. Elle mène son activité au domicile conjugal en compagnie de ses amies. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle qui viennent acheter en gros et les revendre en détail. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de six ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association SABALY de Sanooubougou I), elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel commerçant , tous correctement remboursés.
 Vue son expérience dans l’activité au quartier, Madame   Safiatou D.  vend ses marchandises au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée très généralement de femmes. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 40 sacs de manioc à Sikasso et environnants  et 63 sacs de pâtes de manioc (Tièkèdoro) à Bouaké (République de la Côte d Ivoire) afin de les mélanger pour donner d’Attièkè de bonne qualité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Ms. Safiatou D., aged 49, resides in a large family with her husband and six children (one boy and five girls) in Sanoubougou I, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses unsuccessfully, Safiatou became familiar with this business making attieke. She learned it from a neighbor from the Republic of Cote d’Ivoire over twenty years ago and operates out of her conjugal home along with her friends.  She is much in demand by her customers, who come to buy wholesale and then sell retail. To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, Safiatou decided to rejoin the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso over six years ago. After three solidarity loans (group loans) in a women’s association in her district (Association SABALY de Sanooubougou I), she is now on her fifth individual merchant loan. The previous loans were properly repaid. Given her business experience in the area, Safiatou accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed generally of women. With this loan, she intends to buy 40 sacks of cassava in and around Sikasso and 36 sacks of cassava pasta (tièkèdoro) in Bouaké (Republic of Cote d’Ivoire) in order to blend them for making a good quality attieke. Safiatou envisions making a monthly profit of 250,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to cover more of the family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: Buying cassava and cassava pasta

loans.name: Gulinar

texts.en:
Gulinar is a brave married woman who works hard for the good of her three children. The strict discipline she uses with her children allows her to count on her household’s advice and support in working the fields. Gulinar’s children’s grateful attitude continues to encourage her and they have gathered many lessons that they can use when they form their own households. What Gulinar urgently needs right now are fertilizers and other chemicals for the care of their crops so that they can produce a product that is in line with the demands of the market. Gulinar doesn’t just need good land; she also needs a friendly hand to help her out.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Jovid

texts.en:
Since he was a young boy, Jovid has known how to work. His parents taught him how to get by as a farmer and he learned very well. Now that he is the father of his own family, he still works as a farmer. Thanks to his parents, Jovid now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer and he hopes to increase his agricultural products so that he can bring his loved ones a more promising life. Despite being a good farmer and worker, he needs help to move forward and improve his production. Therefore, Jovid is asking for a loan, so that he can buy more of the seeds and fertilizers he needs, which are very expensive but necessary to improve his production.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and young cattle

loans.name: Houevi  Amivi

texts.fr: Madame  Amivi   est mariée et a 26 ans. Elle est  revendeuse  de chaussures et  boissons alcoolisés. Elle s’approvisionne au grand  marché  de  Lomé  et les revend   au marché local  d’awatamé.  Elle compte dans cette activité  2 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter  35 paires  de  chaussures, 2  cartons  de  dry  gin  et 4 cartons  de pastis.
texts.en:
Madame Amivi est mariée et a 26 ans. Elle est revendeuse de chaussures et boissons alcoolisés. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et les revend au marché local d’awatamé. Elle compte dans cette activité 2 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter 35 paires de chaussures, 2 cartons de dry gin et 4 cartons de pastis.

Mrs. AMivi is 26 years old and married. She sells shoes and alcoholic beverages. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé and resells at the local market of Awatamé. She has been in this business for two years. She is seeking a loan to purchase 35 pairs of shoes, two boxes of dry gin and four boxes of pastis.

loans.use: Purchasing shoes and alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née le 17 septembre 1982 à Sikasso, Fatoumata B. est divorcée et mère de deux garçons vivant dans une grande traditionnelle à Médine-Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès, Fatoumata B. s’est initiée  à cette activité d’alimentation depuis plus de cinq ans. Elle mène son activité devant son domicile à Médine Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux ans. Elle a bénéficié deux prêts qui ont été remboursés avec succès.
Ainsi, elle sollicite un troisième prêt pour lui permettre d’acheter auprès de ses fournisseurs de Sikasso mais aussi de Bamako, 40 casiers de boisson BRAMALI, 50 paquets de boisson NBB, 70 cartons d’eau minérale, 8 cartons de lait Candia, 30 cartons de boisson en canette  de différentes sortes (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio, etc), 15 paquets d’eau minérale en sachets, des cartons de biscuits de qualités différentes, etc.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born on September 17, 1982 in Sikasso, Ms. Fatoumata B. is a divorced mother of two boys living in a large traditional family in Médine-Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses unsuccessfully, she became familiar with this grocery business over five years ago. She operates in front of her home in Médine Sikasso, where she is much in demand by her customers.

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, Fatoumata decided to rejoin the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about two years ago. She has benefited from two loans, which have been repaid successfully. 

And so, she is requesting a third loan to enable her to buy goods from her suppliers from Sikasso but also from Bamako: 40 cases of BRAMALI beverages, 50 packs of NBB beverages, 70 boxes of mineral water, 8 boxes of Candia milk, 30 boxes of canned beverages of various sorts (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio, etc), 15 packs of mineral water in sachets, a few boxes of cookies of various sorts, etc.

With this loan, Fatoumata envisions making a monthly profit of 300,00 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help with family expenses, and to pay the loan interest.

loans.use: Buying various grocery items

loans.name: Urinboy

texts.en:
S. Urinboy is 39 years old and married with two children. Urinboy is dedicated to his agricultural business. Having little knowledge in the beginning, he had to learn a lot about farming and has now acquired fair experience in agriculture. Urinboy is very happy because his children are the motivation for his desire to develop his business. He approached IMON International to obtain a loan to buy more seeds and fertilizer to sow for a good harvest and to take care of his children and his home.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Amé Mawulawoé

texts.fr: Dame  Mawulawoè   habite Djidjolé. Elle  a 44 ans et est mariée. Elle a 2 enfants à charge.   Pour participer  au  ménage, elle fait la restauration.  Elle achète les ingrédients de restauration  au grand  marché  de Lomé.  Elle revend à côté  de  la  pharmacie Djidjolé  après  préparation.  Elle a commencé  en 2009 cette  activité  et  a employé 2 personnes.  Elle sollicite de  WAGES un prêt  pour acheter  5 sacs de maïs  et  5  sacs  de riz.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mawulawoè lives in Djidjolé. She's 44 years old, married, and has two children to support. To provide for her household, she runs a food serving business. She buys ingredients at the Grand Market in Lomé, and sells the prepared meals next to the pharmacy in Djidjolé.

She started this business in 2009, and used to employ two persons. She's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 5 sacks of corn and 5 sacks of rice.

loans.use: To buy 5 sacks of corn and 5 sacks of rice for her food serving business

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Madame Salimata S. a plus de 34 ans mariée, elle réside avec son époux et ses quatre (4) enfants (2 garçons et 2 filles) à Banconi, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Salimata S. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès, elle s’est initiée à cette activité de stockage et commercialisation des  céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho, etc.) depuis plus de sept (07) ans. Elle dispose son magasin à Kaboïla I en face de la B.O.A. (Banque Ouest Africaine). Dans le soucis de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de joindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ six (06) ans. Après 5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association Kotognogontala de Banconi), et elle est actuellement à son 7ème prêt individuel, tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 25 sacs de Maïs, 10 sacs de Sorgho et 10 sacs de Mil. Elle s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso avant de les revendre soit en gros à une clientèle composée généralement des chefs de famille.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salimata S. is over 34 years old and married. She lives with her husband and four children (two boys and two girls) in Banconi, a peripheral district in the city of Sikasso (the third administrative district of Mali).

After trying many different business activities without success, Salimata S. turned to stocking and reselling cereals (corn, millet, sorghum etc), which she has been engaged in for seven years now. She has a warehouse in Kaboila I, across the street from the Banque Ouest Africaine building.

In order to better meet the growing customer demand, about six years ago she decided to join the mircrofinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After five solidarity (group) loans under the aegis of a women’s association of her local area (Association Kotognogontala of Banconi), she is now on her 7th individual loan. All previous loans have been duly repaid.

She plans to use this loan to purchase 25 bags of corn, 10 bags of sorghum and 10 bags of millet. She stocks up in the village around Sikasso in order to resell her goods, often in large quantities, to a customer base composed mainly of household heads. With this loan, she plans to achieve a monthly income of 250,000 West African Francs, which will basically be used to bolster her business capital, contribute to the family budget and pay off the interest on her loan, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing cereals

loans.name: Yokubjon

texts.en:
Yokubjon is 30 years old and lives with his wife and three children. From a young age, he demonstrated a talent for agriculture. Yokubjon has always tried to be very responsible and very content with his farm work. When he finishes caring for his crops, he goes to help his father because he wants to repay his father’s efforts. What his father likes best out of the whole agricultural process is the marketing because he always hopes to get a good price for his crops. But once he gets to the market, he becomes a little clumsy and sometimes loses track of the accounting. Yokubjon always tries to help him out with some pointers. Yokubjon is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his varied crops. The loan will greatly improve Yokubjon’s income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Eteri

texts.en:
Eteri R. lives in Vanadzor city. She lives alone as her only son is serving in the army now. For the past 10 years, Eteri has managed a clothes trading business in a rented shop. She sells various kinds of clothes: men’s, women’s and children’s clothes, outerwear, bathrobes, socks, etc. Eteri purchases merchandise in Yerevan to sell in her shop in Vanadzor city and thus supports herself and her son. 
 
Eteri has received ten loans from Nor Horizon and she has never delayed her repayments. Now she is asking for a 700,000 dram loan to buy a spring clothes assortment for her business.

loans.use: To buy a spring clothes assortment

loans.name: Berdikul

texts.en: Y. Berdikul was born on August 2, 1948. Coming from an area where raising cattle is popular, Berdikul has been selling cattle since 1996. He buys them in his village from farmers who raise them and then sells them at the markets. As his business capital is limited, he buys just a few and after he sells those, he returns to buy more. Berdikul would like to expand his business and increase his capital so that he can maximize his profits. For this reason, Berdikul is requesting this loan to purchase calves. This will be his first loan with IMON International and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan. loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Daler

texts.en: F. Daler is 24 years old. Together with his wife, they have been raising two children. Daler is an experienced bread baker. He has been in this business for more than seven years. He bakes the national bread lepeshka at home. His brother helps him with the business. Having many customers, Daler is selling most of his products right from his place. However, he also runs a trading place in the local central market for selling the lepeshka. Now Daler requests a 7000 somoni loan. He is planning to purchase flour wholesale as required for his business. Daler is grateful to all supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.
