loans.use: Purchasing flour wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen G. was born in 1981 in Kapan. He lives with his parents, his wife and his two sons. Armen’s wife stays at home and takes care of their children. 

For about two years, Armen has running his butcher’s shop. He buys pork, beef, veal, mutton, lamb and chicken meat from villagers and sells it in his shop. Armen works very hard without any free days and thereby is able to keep his family. 

Armen asks for a $1,900 loan to buy a large lot of meat for his butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy a large lot of meat for his butcher shop

loans.name: Tuelewane Group

texts.fr: Kituri B. est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe d’affaire Tuelewana, âgée de 40  ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants. Son marie est un hôtelier. La cliente  Kituri B. est  vendeuse des produits manufacturés (mayonnaise, spaghetti, laits Nido, savons, etc.). Elle s’installe  a son domicile devant sa parcelle. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu de son mari ayant une valeur de 100$. Il ya 19 ans qu’elle est en activité. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits (3 casiers de Fanta, 5 cartons d’huile végétale Rina, 1 carton de laits Nido, 3 cartons de mayonnaises, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants. La cliente Kituri B. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Tuelewana est constitué de 15 membres.
texts.en: Kituri B. is a businesswoman and the president of the group named Tuelewana. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 10 children. Her husband is a hotel owner. Kituri B. is a general products merchant (mayonnaise, spaghetti, powdered milk, soaps, etc.). She has her business installed in the front section of her house. She started her business with her own funds that she received from her husband, amounting to $100. She has had her business for 19 years. Her new loan will be used to acquire new products (3 cases of Fanta brand soft drinks, 5 cartons of Rina brand cooking oil, 1 carton of Nido brand powdered milk, 3 cartons of mayonnaise, etc.). In addition, she also plans on expanding her business and to send her kids to school. Kituri B. is thankful to Hekima (Kiva Field Partner) for their actions towards the poor women who are excluded from traditional banks. The Tuelewana group is made up of 15 members.

loans.use: To purchase general merchandise for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ngorongoro Group

texts.en:
Nagenjwa Ngema, who is in her early thirties is married with two kids. She has been running a fruit and vegetable business since 2002. She works from 5:00am to 8:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Nagenjwa's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start the fruit and vegetable business. She also built a small house. She has paid back her previous loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase her stock of fruits and vegetables. Her dream is to build another house.

Nagenjwa will share this loan with her loan group, Ngorongoro which has a total of 20 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

In the picture, Nagenjwa is the one infront.

loans.use: To increase stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Surik

texts.en: Surik A. lives in Goraik village of the Syunik region. Surik lives with his mother and newlywed wife. The family has a cattlefarm and is engaged in land cultivation. The Syunik region has severe cold climate, which is suited for cattle farming. Currently there is increased demand for small cattle on the market. To enlarge the business and increase the profit for his growing family Surik has applied for this loan to purchase more cattle.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Donkey and Cart for transportation of goods sold

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon is 34 years old, and married with 4 children. Abdurahmon has worked in agriculture since he was a young man. His father taught him how to responsibly work with each crop, and now, with the help of his wife and adult children, he feels a sense of dignity from his work. As a consequence, he treats each plant with affection and care until they are ready for harvest, at which point he takes them to sell in the market.

Abdurahmon would very much like to buy a house in the city to ensure the well-being and tranquility of his children and in this way improve his quality of life. The money that Abdurahmon is soliciting is for the purchase of seeds, chemical fertilizers, fuels and lubricants. Let’s support this hard-working and talented man so that he can obtain his goals!   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Jessika K.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the R.C Hanga II Primary School in Kenema city. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of SLL 6,500,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will each be able to improve their standard of living. 

Fifty-five year old Jessika K. K. is the leader of this group of teachers. Jessika was born in Kailahun, she is married and has 2 children who are in college. Jessika is a teacher and a businesswoman. She has been in the teaching profession for 35 years now. Jessika is going to use her share of this loan to invest in her business. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish some certain tasks that they would otherwise have not been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Lilian Wambui

texts.en:
Lilian K. is 38 years old and is a single mother of two children. She operates a salon in Kawaha West for two years now and earns a profit of KES 8,000.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use entire loan amount to buy new clothes for the boutique shop and also buy some cosmetics for sale. She will invest the anticipated profits back into the business.

Lilian hopes to grow her business and in the future purchase a plot and build a home for her children.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for the boutique shop and buy some cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en:
Farzona is an entrepreneur from Kumsangir, Tajikistan, where she sells women’s and kid’s clothing. Farzona is a married mom of two kids. She manages to balance family and work, effectively managing her time with wisdom and thorough planning. Farzona has been in this trade for 10 years. She is a true venturer. She takes risks and handles challenges with endurance and perseverance. Farzona pursues success of her business and seeks to see it flourish and thrive. This time Farzona is requesting a loan of 6500 Somoni to re-stock her inventory and generate additional income. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increase working capital with the purpose of development of business.

loans.name: Jara

texts.en:
Jara A. is a sixty-seven year old widowed lady. She is a mother of four grown chidren. She owns rental houses in Kibera estate. She is served by Kitengela branch. She has been in this business for the last fifty years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints, especially when there is a need to renovate the houses.

She works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to renovate her rental houses. She hopes to buy another plot and build more rental houses in future. She sees herself building flats to let some day. She describes herself as hardworking, honest and keeps on schedule.

loans.use: Renovation of rental houses.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a 57-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating six business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store, dry goods, mineral water refill, buying & selling wood, electronic re-loading and room-for-rent businesses.  She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her six businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 27,000.  Luciana is borrowing PHP 29,500 to fund her business operations. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Luciana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To fund her business operations

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela A. O. is a single lady. She has two children aged nineteen years old and fifteen years old. She owns a beauty salon and it is well known by the name LOVE Salon. She serves the local women by dressing their hair. She also sells hair relaxers, weaves, treatments, shampoos, etc. Her business is located at Kibera and she is served by the Kitengela branch.

She has been in this business for the last ten years now and has managed to give employment to four people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to open a new salon to serve more people and make more income. She hopes to grow her businesses, buy a plot of land and build commercial houses. She describes herself as hardworking, honest and punctual.

loans.use: Open a new salon.

loans.name: Katuriba

texts.en: Katuriba P. is a client from Rukungiri. He is 56 years old and married, with 8 children, 4 of whom are in school. Katuriba is a poultry farmer from Rubumba Cell.   He sells eggs and chickens, both layers and broilers. He employs one person to help with the business.  His customers are the local people from Kebisoni Trading centre and Rukungiri Town. On average, Katuriba makes 300,000UGX as a monthly profit.  He became involved in this business after being the National Agricultural Advisory Service (NAADS) Coordinator in his region. He has been in this business for 5 years  Because he is hard-working, he has been able succeed. His future plan is to buy a hatchery machine so that he can begin supplying chicks to other farmers. In addition to his poultry business, P. has a banana plantation.  He is involved in the sale of milk and produce. He needs a loan to help buy more chicks to raise.

loans.use: To buy more chicks to raise

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
BADEGNA est un groupement de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant à dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs époux et enfants  à BOUGOUNI dans le quartier Massablacoura (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Les membres du groupe BADEGNA se sont connus à travers des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans l’idée de trouver un fonds de commerce suffisante pour satisfaire leurs clientèles, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles utilisent les prêts pour faire le commerce de céréales, d’articles divers et par Badibi S.  pour faire le commerce d’habillements.  Elles sont à leurs cinquièmes prêts dont tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement à l’échéance.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Badibi S.  la présidente du groupe, compte acheter,  20 complets (pantalons et chemises) pour garçon, 10 douzaines de complets pour enfants et  25 complets de filles.  
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako chez les grossistes et effectue sa vente en détail à la maison et au marché, en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 FCFA  qui sera totalement réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
BADEGNA is a group of four married women who, on average are 40 years old, have 5 children, and live with their husbands and children in Bougouni in the Massablacoura (third largest administrative region in the republic of Mali). The members of the BADEGNA group met each other via families ties or living in the same neighborhoods. In order to find sufficient funds to satisfy their customers, these women decided to join the loan program at microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.

The loan will be used to purchase large quantities of grains as well as other diverse products such as clothing for Badibi S.. This will be their fifth loan; the first four were reimbursed in a timely manner. WIth this new loan, Badibi S., the president of the group, plans to purchase 20 sets (shirts and pants) for children, 10 sets for children and 25 sets for girls. She stocks up in Bamako from wholesale vendors and sells the clothing from her home as well as in the market, both for cash as well as credit to customers composed of both men and women. She hopes this loan will enable her to gain monthly profits of 15,000 FCFA [approximately 32 USD] which will be fully reinvested her business.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Rico, who is 44 years old, works as a government employee to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 8 to 20 years old. One of the children has his own family and the other two are currently going to school. Annabelle joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Annabelle has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 21,000 to pirchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children's education and future family needs. Annabelle is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah W. N. is a single lady. She is a mother of two children, aged ten years and six years.  She hopes to give them a good education to the university level. She owns a curio shop, known as Manyatta Curio Shop. She sells curios to local and international tourists. Her business is located at Kajiado and she is served by the Kitengela branch. She has been in this business for the last six years and has managed to give employment to three people. She says that this business is profitable. The major challenge is seasonal because she depends on the tourists.  However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to pay rent and the license fee for her premises. She will add stock with the remainder of the money. She hopes to grow her business, purchase land and build rental houses in future. She describes herself as a very hardworking lady.

loans.use: Rent, license and curios

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent avec leurs époux et enfants  dans des familles nucléaires dans le quartier Faraba à BOUGOUNI (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont rencontrées à travers  leurs activités qui est le commerce de Boissons, de chaussure, de médicaments et de condiments alimentaires avec  Bintou T.. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter la taille de leur entreprise, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt  et le premier prêt a été bien soldé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Bintou T., compte acheter, 2 sacs de 50 kg d’Oignons, 10 paquets de cube maggi  et 1 bidon de 20 litres d’huile.
Elle s’approvisionne au niveau des grossistes sur place au grand marché de BOUGOUNI et effectue sa vente a la maison, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise et l’autre partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The women of the BENKADI group are married, have an average age of 39 years and 5 children. They live with their husbands and children in nuclear families in the Faraba neighborhood of BOUGOUNI (third largest administrative region of the republic of Mali). They met through their businesses of selling drinks, shoes, medicine and other products, including the sale of food condiments for Bintou T.. 

In order to satisfy their customers and increase the size of their business, they have decided to join the loan program offered by microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. They are currently on their second loan, the first having been reimbursed in a timely manner. With this new loan, Bintou T. plans to purchase two bags of 50 kilos of onions, 10 packs of maggi bouillon cubes and 1 20 liter bottle of oil. She stocks up from the wholesalers at the main market in BOUGOUNI and then sells the products from her home for both cash and credit to a customer base mostly comprised of women. With this loan she hopes to earn a monthly profit of 10,000 FCF [approximately 21 USD], a part of which will be reinvested in her business and the other part will be used to pay back her loan.

loans.use: Purchasing condiments

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 56-year-old separated woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a pig fattening businesses. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Rosie is borrowing PHP 15,000 to fund her business operations. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To fund her business operations

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant avec leurs époux et enfants  dans des familles nucléaires dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de BOUGOUNI (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont rencontrées à travers  des relations de commerce  et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter la taille de leur entreprise, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles achètent avec les  prêts des chaussures, des  articles d’étalagistes, et avec  Djénébou K. pour acheter des céréales.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Djénébou K., compte acheter, 4 sacs de 50 kg de riz fumé, 2 sacs de 100 kg de Maïs et 2 sacs de 100 kg de petit mil.
Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages voisins au niveau des cultivateurs pour en suite revendre au marché en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elles compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise et l’autre partie sera utilisée pour des frais de santé.
texts.en:
The members of the BENKADI group are all married women with an average age of 35 and 5 children who live with their husbands and children in nuclear families in the Massablacoura neighborhood of the city of BOUGOUNI (third largest administrative region of the republic of Mali). They met through their businesses as well as neighborhood contacts. In order to satisfy their customers and increase the size of their businesses, they decided to join the loan program offered by microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.

They will use the loan to purchase shoes, window displays and, for Djénébou K. in particular, to purchase grains. With this new loan, K. plans to purchase four 50 kilo bags of smoked rice, two 100 kilo bags of maize/corn and two 100 kilo bags of millet. She stocks up on products from farmers in the nearby villages and then re-sells them at the market for both cash and credit, to a customer base comprised of both women and men. With this loan she hopes to make a monthly profit of 20,000 FCF [approximately 42 USD], a part of which will be reinvested in her business and the part used to cover medical expenses.

loans.use: Achat  Céréales

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaire avec leurs  enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident à Massablacoura l’un des quartier de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des relations de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et élargir la taille de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce de céréales, de poissons et des ustensiles de cuisines à l’image de  Kadia D..
Elles sont à leur vingt deuxième prêt de groupe dont tous les  vingt un  précédents ont été remboursés correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Kadia D., compte acheter, 20 douzaine de tasses INOX, (grand, petit et moyen modèle), 3 cartons de tasse thermos et 8 cartons de verre à café et  40 douzaines de cuillères.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako capitale de la république du Mali au niveau des grossistes pour les revendre  en détail , au comptant et à crédit au grand marché de BOUGOUNI  à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise et le reste sera  utilisé dans la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
The group named Djiguisseme is made up of married women averaging 45 years in age and each has 6  children.  They live in conjugal nuclear families with their children and husband. These women  live in Massablacoura, a quarter in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the  Republic of Mali). 

They are known through family and in the neighborhood. 

IN order to satisfy their clients and in order to increase their business activities, they have decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner).  It will help them with their business selling cereal grains, fish, and kitchen utensils through Kadia  D.. 

They are no their twentieth group loan and all twenty previous loans were successfully repaid. 

With this new loan Kadia D. will purchase 20 dozen Inox brand drinking cups (large, small,  and medium size models), 3 cartons of thermos containers, 8 cartons of coffee mugs, and 40 dozen  spoons. 

She makes her purchases in Bamako, the capital city of the Republic of Mali, from the  wholesalers with the intent to resell in retail. She completes her sales in cash and credit in  the large market in Bougouni and she sells to a clientele generally made up of  women. 

With this loan she expects to earn a monthly income of 20.000 FCFA, a part of which will be  reinvested in the business and the rest will be used to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ayélé Mawuéna

texts.fr: Dame  Ayélé est  mariée et  a 41 ans.  Elle a à charge  un enfant.  Elle fait la  vente   de  sacs dame   à Atikoumé. Elle  s’approvisionne au grand  marché de  Lomé  et compte dans cette  activité 6 ans d’expérience.  Elle  sollicite  de WAGES  un prêt  pour  acheter  20  sacs dame. Elle  est  née  à  Lomé  et habite  quartier  Agbalépédo.
texts.en: Ayele is married and she is 41 years old. She has one child in her care. She sells ladies’ hand bags at Atikoume. She makes her purchases in the large market in Lome and she has 6 years’ experience in the business. She requests a loan from Wages (Kiva Field Partner) to purchase 20 ladies’ purses. She was born in Lome and she lives in the Agbalepedo quarter.

loans.use: To purchase ladies' handbags.

loans.name: Laïdou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAÏDOU est composé de femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et 7 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs  enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident à Massablacoura l’un des quartier de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des relations de voisinage, et de commerce. 
Dans l’idée de trouver un font de commerce suffisante pour satisfaire la clientèle, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour faire le commerce médicaments traditionnels, de Riz, d’habillements, des bois de chauffe et du charbon  avec Kadiatou K.. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Avec ce prêt Kadiatou K., compte acheter, 10 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe  et 20 sacs de charbon de bois.
Elle est approvisionnée par des fournisseurs venant des villages environnants pour  ensuite  être revendu en détail et en en gros, au comptant et à crédit au grand marché de BOUGOUNI et à la maison à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elles comte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour remboursé le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Laïdou Group is composed of married women, who on average are 42 years old and have seven children. They live with their children and husbands in nuclear families in Massablacoura, a neighborhood in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali). They came to know each other through ties of neighborhood and business.

Faced with the need to increase their working capital to satisfy their clientele, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to finance their activities, namely selling traditional medicine, rice and clothes; Kadiatou Kanté sells firewood and coal. This is their first group loan.

Mrs Kadiatou Kanté intends to buy 10 cartloads of firewood and 20 sacks of charcoal. She gets her supplies from merchants in nearby villages and sells her goods retail or wholesale, for cash or credit, at the great market in Bougouni and from her home to a clientele made up of men and women.

Thanks to this loan, they expect to make an average profit of 20,000 CFA francs a month. They will use it to repay their loan and reinvest the remaining amount in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Ta-Landeneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Ta-Landeneh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the second loan that these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Zainab B..  Zainab is age 30.  She was born in  Makeni city, where she is currently residing with her husband and 4 children. Her husband is a businessman.  Two of her children attend primary school and two are in secondary school. For 6 years, Zainab has been selling soaps, cigarettes, powdered milk, sugar, butter, etc.  With her share of this loan, Zainab is going to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy soaps, cigarettes, powdered milk, sugar, butter, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
SABALI est un  groupement de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 50 ans, 6 enfants et vivant dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs époux et enfants  à Massablacoura l’un des quartier de la ville de  BOUGOUNI (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Les membres du groupe SABALI se sont connus à travers des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans l’idée de trouver un font de commerce suffisante pour satisfaire la clientèle, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles utilisent les prêts pour faire le commerce de salades, de céréales, d’article divers et par Fanta B.  pour faire le commerce de condiments.  Elles sont à leur huitième prêt et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Fanta B., compte acheter, 5 paniers de tomate, 4 sacs d’oignons, 2 sacs de 25 kg de sel et 4 paquets de cube maggi.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de BOUGOUNI au niveau des grossistes et effectue sa vente en détail à la maison et au marché, en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’activité, et le reste pour rembourser le prêt et payé les frais de santé.
texts.en:
Sabali Group is composed of four married women, who on average are 50 years old and have six children. They live with their husbands and children in nuclear families in Massablacoura, a neighborhood in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali). They came to know each other through ties of kinship and neighborhood.

Faced with the need to increase their working capital to satisfy their clientele, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They need the loans to finance their activities, namely selling salad, cereals and various articles; Fanta B. sells food condiments. This is their eighth loan. Their previous loans have been repaid on schedule. 

Mrs Fanta B. intends to use her new loan to buy 5 baskets of tomatoes, 4 sacks of onions, 2 sacks of 25 kilograms of salt and 4 packs of bouillon cubes. She gets her supplies from wholesalers at the great market in Bougouni and retails from her home and at the market, for cash or credit, to a clientele made up of women and men.

Thanks to this loan, she expects to make an average profit of 20,000 CFA francs a month. She will use part of it to reinvest in her business and the remaining amount to repay the loan and pay for healthcare services.

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Dame  Massan  est  mariée  et mère  de  3  enfants.  Elle  a  41  ans  et  fait   le commerce  de  produits  génériques  et les articles de  merceries.  Elle  achète  les  produits  à  Togo pharma, les articles au grand marché de Lomé  et  revend  à  côté du  marché  local  d’assiyéyé.  Elle a  débuté  en  2002  son  activité   et a remboursé déjà  3 crédits.   Pour répondre à  la demande sans cesse  croissante, elle demande un  prêt.
texts.en: Massan is married and she is the mother of 3 children. She is 41 years old and she sells general merchandise and furnishings. She purchases her products at Togo Pharma and the articles of furnishing at the large market in Lome, to resell beside the local market of Assiyeye. She started her business in 2002 and she has successfully repaid 3 past loans. In order to meet the demand of her ever-growing clientele, she requests a loan.

loans.use: To purchase general merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaire avec leurs  enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident à dans le quartier Massablacoura à BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leur activité, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce de condiments et de céréales  avec  Rokia D.. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Rokia D., compte acheter, 2 sacs de 100kg de Maïs, 1 sacs de 100kg de petit mil, 3 sacs de 50 kg de Riz fumé.
Elle s’approvisionne au niveau cultivateur dans des villages environnants pour les revendre  au grand marché de BOUGOUNI en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Benkadi Group ("Harmony") is composed of married women, who on average are 34 years old and have four children. They live with their children and husbands in nuclear families in Massablacoura, a neighborhood in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali). They came to know each other through ties of kinship and neighborhood.

Faced with the need to increase their working capital to satisfy their clientele and boost their activity level, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They need the loans to finance their activities, namely selling food condiments and cereals (Rokia D.). This is their seventh group loan. All their previous loans have been repaid on schedule. 

Mrs Rokia D. intends to use her new loan to buy 2 sacks of 100 kilograms of corn, 1 sack of 100 kilograms of small millet and 3 sacks of 50 kilograms of smoked rice. She gets her supplies from farmers in nearby villages and retails at the great market in Bougouni, for cash or credit, to a clientele made up of men and women.

Thanks to this loan, she expects to make an average profit of 20,000 CFA francs a month. She will use part of it to repay her loan and the remaining amount will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying more maize, millet and coffee for increased stock.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a married woman who lives in Escalante City, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating a dried fish vending business and a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Gregorio, who is 60 years old, helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are 13 to 19 years old. Angelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Angelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future education of their children. Angelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, 46 years old, lives in the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 3 children. She is engaged in farming. She plants and harvests rice crops for sale. She also raises pigs and runs a sari-sari store. Mary Jane does her best to help provide for her family's needs.

Mary Jane joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase feeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Pauline Akuvi

texts.fr: Madame Akuvi  est  mariée et  a  3  enfants.  Agée  de  45  ans, elle  participe  au   foyer  et   fait  le  commerce  de pagnes, bijoux et produits de beauté .   Elle s’approvisionne  au  grand  marché  de  Lomé et  revend  dans une boutique à  côté du bar  Madiba sur la route La pampa.  Elle  a  commencé  son activité  en  2001. Pour satisfaire  plus  de  clients, elle sollicite un prêt.
texts.en: Akuvi is married and she has 3 children. She is 45 years old and she contributes to the household by selling shawls, jewelry, and beauty products. She makes her purchases at the large market in Lome and resells from her boutique located beside the Madiba bar on La Pampa road. She has had her business since 2001. In order to satisfy a larger clientele, she requests a loan.

loans.use: To purchas shawls, jewelry, and beauty products.

loans.name: Gnel

texts.en:
Gnel A. is 48 years old. He lives in Tsakhkunk village, an area of Sevan. Gnel has a higher education and for several years he worked as a mechanical engineer. 
Since 1998, Gnel, his wife, and his son have engaged in farming. On their farm they raise cows, sheep and chickens. Gnel says farming is very laborious, but it allows him to meet his family’s needs. 
Gnel and his family intend to enlarge their farm, which will allow them to increase their family's income in the future.  Gnel is seeking a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy some cows for his farm.

loans.use: To buy some cows for his farm

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 53 years old, married, and blessed with five children. He is a very hard-working businessman who sells second-hand household goods such as cupboards and chairs. He has been in this business for two years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become very focused in his business and he has employed one person. He is also a farmer and runs a transportation business in order to supplement his family’s income. He dreams of opening a honey-processing business in the future. He needs 60,000 KES to repair the vehicle which he uses for his transportation business and to renovate his business facility.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle and renovate his business facility

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda A. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 48 years old. Minda is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Minda owns & operates a  business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Minda also grows pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market.

Minda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Minda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Minda is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and pig feed.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and pig feed

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
42-year-old Myrna is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Myrna works hard to improve her family's living conditions.

Myrna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 55 years old, lives in the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Myrna also helps her husband maintain their rice farm. She also manages their sari-sari store, where they sell canned goods and other products.

Myrna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase 3 piglets, feed, and farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase 3 piglets, feed and farm inputs

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Lun S., 22, resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. S. is a traditional Apsara dancer, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. Her husband is a chef, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 43 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. Lun is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Dourng

texts.en: Dourng S., 38, resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. Dourng sells traditional cakes, earning an income of USD 10 per day. Her husband is a teacher, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 82 on food and USD 50 on the other necessary expenses. Dourng is requesting a loan of USD 700 to produce more cakes and buy snacks to sell at a local school. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To produce more cakes and buy snacks to resell

loans.name: Musyimi

texts.en:
Musyimi N., 45, is married to Monica, and they are blessed with two children. He has been in the business of making and selling ice cream for eight years and he earns a profit of KES 15,000 per month from this business.

N. has a very good credit history with KADET. He has applied for his fourth loan after paying the previous loans successfully. He plans to use the entire loan amount to buy raw materials like sugar, milk powder, and food color.

He will use the additional income generated from the loan to educate his children. In the future he hopes to set up his own factory.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like sugar, milk powder and food color

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida J. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 45 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nelida raises pigs for fattening and sale. Nelida also helps her husband at their rice farm by working to keep the crops healthy. 

Nelida joined Kiva field partner CEVI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelida has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nelida is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase rice seed, fertilizer and pig feed.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed, fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S., 39, resides with her family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. S. sells vegetables at a local market in the province, earning U.S. $7 per day. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver, and earns U.S. $3.50 per day.

Each month, the family has to spend U.S. $42 on food and U.S. $78 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of U.S. $800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for use as a taxi

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 62-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a fishing business.  She lives in Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Lucia is borrowing PHP 23,000 to fund her business operations. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lucia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upom a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva,org

loans.use: Funds for her business operations

loans.name: Chay

texts.en:
Chay D., 45, resides with his family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. D. is a motorcycle taxi driver, and earns U.S. $10 per day. His wife is a masseuse at the night market in the town, and earns U.S. $6 per day.

Each month, the family has to spend U.S. $50 on food and U.S. $50 on the other necessary expenses. D. is requesting a loan of U.S. $1,200 to purchase a new motorbike. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a married woman who lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari sari (general) store and a sugar cane/farming business.  Her husband Jose, who is 62 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are 25 to 37 years old. Concepcion joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Concepcion has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 to use as more funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for future family expenses.  Concepcion is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 46 years old and the father of two, ages 7 and 14.  He runs N. Transporters business to earn his daily bread.  He was able to start the business after getting enough capital from his previous business where he was selling scrap metals.  He thanks Faulu Kenya for supporting his previous business.  He hopes to have several trucks for transport in the future.  He has requested 60,000 KES to buy a computer and accessories for his business.

loans.use: To buy a computer and accessories for his business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan P. is from the town of Santo Niño. She is 48 years old. Susan is married and has five children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. Susan is working hard to sustain her family and pay for her children's education.

She joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Susan is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Roxana Magaly

texts.es: La Sra.  Roxana de 38 años de edad estado civil casada tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, vive en casa familiar en la zona quinto anillo de la ciudad de Santa Cruz. La Sra.  Roxana da a trabajar su auto como taxi y percibe una renta diaria, ya que ella tiene la actividad de promotora de cosméticos,. El dinero que solicito la Sra. Roxana es para  la (Compra de conversión de  equipo a gas y mantenimiento) y así reducir el gasto de lo implica la compra de gasolina  La clienta quedo muy agradecida por la confianza depositada en su persona y por la atención que recibió.
texts.en:
Roxana, 38, is married and has three school age children.  She lives in the family home in Santa Cruz’s Quinto Anillo zone.  

Roxana leases out her vehicle to be used as a taxi and she receives a daily rental fee since her job is as a cosmetics saleswoman.

The money she’s asking for is to buy a gas conversion kit and for vehicle maintenance and repair to reduce the cost that gasoline usage implies.

She was very grateful for the trust placed in her and for the way she was treated.

loans.use: To buy a gas conversion kit and for vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Gemmalyn

texts.en:
Gemmalyn is a married woman who lives in Danao City, Cebu.  She earns her living by operating an abaca weaving business.  Her husband Joselito, who is 27 years old, works as a driver to earn his living.  They have four children who are 5 months to 7 years old. Gemmalyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gemmalyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000 to buy materials and abaca to weave so that she can continue to save up for future improvements for her business. Gemmalyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.Kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase materials for abaca weaving

loans.name: Chao

texts.en:
Chao C., 60, resides with his family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. C. is a fisherman, earning an income of about $7 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $70 on food and $30 on the other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Roselita

texts.en:
Roselita is a 37-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a business buying and selling firewood/charcoal.  She lives in Danao City, Cebu.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her buying and selling of firewood/charcoal business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000.  Roselita is borrowing PHP 14,000 to purchase more stock to sell.   This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Roselita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Kuy T., 53, resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. T. uses her bicycle to sell firewood, earning an income of about $2 per day. Two of her children are employed at different workplaces to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $35 on the other necessary expenses. 

T. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for her child to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her child to commute to work

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a 35-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  a general store , e-loading and a trisikad transport business. She lives in Danao City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Bernadette is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Bernadette aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.Kiva.org

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em B., 51, resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. B. sells snacks from her home, earning an income of about $2.90 per day. One of her children is employed at a factory, earning an income of about $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $79 on food and $20 on the other necessary expenses. 

B. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her child to start a business as a motor-taxi driver. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her child to start a business

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng S., 61, resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Bora is a farmer, earning an income of about $1.30 per day. Her husband is a retired policeman, earning an income of about $1.43 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $77 on food and $20 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to pay the children’s school fees. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to pay the children's school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize and beans

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy S., 44, resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. produces traditional baskets, earning an income of about $2 per day. Her husband sells palm products, earning an income of about $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $69 on food and $10 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Albertina forma parte del Banco comunal “El tiempo es oro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y  venta de sus productos de amasandería, los cuales consisten en; empanadas, humitas y tortas. Trabajo que realiza cuando sus clientes le solicitan productos, especialmente los fines de semana, festivos y ocasionalmente en eventos. De esta manera entrega a domicilio sus productos de amasandería.
Albertina trabaja desde hace 2 años y 6 meses en este rubro. Además se dedica a dar almuerzos a un grupo de ancianos por las tardes. 
Albertina vive con su esposo, su hija y dos nietas.
El préstamo de Fondo esperanza lo utilizará como uso personal, ya que a causa del terremoto del 27 de febrero de 2010, su casa fue devastada, por lo cual comprará  materiales de construcción para arreglar los muros de su casa y así con esto vivir más tranquila. 
Su sueño es tener una amasandería donde pueda preparar todos sus productos y seguir entregándolos a domicilio. Respecto a su casa su sueño es arreglarla completamente, pero necesita de mucho dinero, para hacerlo posible.
A Albertina le han sido muy útiles los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza para la mantención de su negocio y reconstrucción de su hogar. En relación a las reuniones grupales que realiza el Banco comunal al que pertenece, ella se siente muy cómoda y contenta con los aprendizajes adquiridos, ya que le han servido para distribuir sus ingresos y ahorrar sus ganancias. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Albertina is a member of the “El Tiempo es Oro” (Time is Gold) communal bank in the city of Concepción.  She manufactures and sells bakery items consisting in turnovers, "humitas" (small cakes made from corn and sugar) and cakes.  She does this work based on orders from customers especially on weekends, holidays and occasionally for special events.  She home delivers her baked goods.  She has been in this line of work for two and a half years.  She also provides lunches for a group of senior citizens in the afternoons.  Albertina lives with her husband, her daughter and two granddaughters.

The Fondo Esperanza loan is for personal use because, due to the February 27, 2010 earthquake, her house was devastated.  She will, therefore, buy building materials and supplies to repair the walls in her house thus living more securely.

Her dream is to own a bakery where she can produce all her products and continue going out to home deliver them.  With respect to her house it is to repair it completely but she needs a lot of money to do so.

Fondo Esperanza loans have been very useful for Albertina to stay in business and rebuild her home.  She feels very happy and content with what she’s learned at the communal bank group meetings; it has served her well to budget her income and save profits.

Concepción is situated at the mouth of the Bíobío River.  It has been very important in our history since it was the site of important battles and settlements, especially during the Arauco War, because it borders Mapuche territory.  Currently the city has an important economic and demographic development being considered one of Chile’s most relevant urban, demographic, administrative, financial and commercial nucleuses after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is 42 years old and married with three children.  He owns and operates a poultry farm to earn a living.  He earns extra income from other employment.  He is able to run his business well because he was trained in business management skills through Faulu Kenya. He hopes to improve his business and become self-employed in the future. He has requested 50,000 KES to buy more layers and broilers.

loans.use: To buy more layers and broilers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 31-year-old businessman who runs a hardware store to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business for five years. He also does farming to supplement his income. He was previously employed as a teacher.  Through Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to keep business records, which has helped him to run his business well. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy pipes and fittings.

loans.use: To buy pipes and fittings

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: El banco D. Emprendimiento "NUEVA ESPERANZA   " es un Bancos que se encuentra en su octavo   ciclo   donD.   demostraron ser  personas responsables y trabajadoras, este grupo esta representada por las siguientes socias: como Presidenta esta la Sra. Elvira   quien es la líder y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio D. venta D. Abarrotes  en  una d las calles mas populosas D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba, Esta Separada    y tiene 5  hijos  D. los cuales todos  son independientes su negocio es propio  y el crédito que solicitó es para compra D. mercadería como fideos, aceites, arroz, y así incrementar su Capital D. trabajo. Como Tesorera esta la  Sra. Julia  quien  esta casada y tiene 2 hijas pequeñas y tiene como negocio una tienda D. barrio en su domicilio, y solicitó el crédito para aumentar su capital   es socia antigua y a demostrado ser  una persona muy responsable y puntual con sus cuotas, toda las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado. En la foto no se encuentra una D. las socias.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank is in its eighth loan cycle and the group members have proven to be responsible and hardworking people. The following members serve as the group representatives:

Elvira is the president, and is the leader and founder of the group. She has a business selling groceries on one of the most populous streets in the city of Cochabamba. She is separated and has five children who are all independent of her. Elvira owns her business and the loan that she requested is for the purchase of merchandise like pasta, oil, rice, and to increase her working capital.

Julia is the treasurer and is married with two small children. She has a neighborhood store in her house and she requested the loan to increase her capital. She is a previous borrower and has proven to be a very responsible person and punctual with her payments.

All of the group members are responsible and hardworking people and they are grateful to Emprender for the support provided. One of the group members does not appear in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise like pasta, oil, and rice

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es: Virginia tiene 53 años, es una microempresaria que tiene un negocio que es una panadería. Empezó con el negocio desde hace 5 años pues su compañero de vida trabajaba con una hermana fue con cierto dinero que tenían ahorrado que lograron establecer su propio negocio. El negocio está ubicado en su vivienda, uno de los mayores desafíos que enfrenta es el precio de la harina ya que está muy cara. Ella tiene una gran cantidad de clientes pues ellos se sienten satisfechos con los productos que ofrece. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de harina, huevos, mantequilla, queso, leña entre otros productos necesarios. En el futuro quiere seguir adelante para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Virginia is 53 years old.  She is a small businesswoman who owns a bakery.  She started this business 5 years ago as her partner was working with one of his sisters.  They decided to use a certain amount of money that they had saved to set up their own business.  The business is located in their home.

One of the greatest challenges that Virginia faces is the price of flour since it is very expensive.  She has a large number of customers who are always satisfied with the products that she sells.

Virginia is requesting this loan to buy flour, eggs, butter, cheese, firewood and other products she needs.  In the future, she would like to continue working and improve her income.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is 44 years old and married with two children. He runs a retail shop to earn his daily bread.  He has been running this business for ten years, and he also earns extra income from his rental houses. He is looking forward to expanding his shop into a wholesale store in the future. Nicholas wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for his shop. For this reason, he has requested a loan of 20,000 KES.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El Sr. Alejandro de  44 años,  de estado civil viudo, con 2 hijas  que se encuentran estudiando, tiene ya varios años dedicándose a la construcción como maestro albañil. El Sr.  Alejandro ha estado trabajando con algunas herramientas propias y las demás alquiladas. Por este motivo se  vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la demanda que se le  presenta. El  no posee ninguna deuda con ninguna institución, es cliente nuevo de Emprender,  cuenta con domicilio conocido ubicado al  Sur de nuestra ciudad, razón por la cual no se le negó dicho crédito, con el dinero del crédito comprara una mezcladora, compra de cortadora de azulejos,  incremento de herramientas de trabajo, es una persona trabajadora que esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 44, is a widower with two daughters who are in school.  He’s been working for several years in construction as a Master Bricklayer.  He has been working with some tools of his own and some leased ones.  Because of this, he found himself in the need of asking our institution for a loan due to the demand he’s facing.  He does not have any debts with any other institution; he’s a new Emprender client.  He has a known place of residence in the south of our city so the loan was not denied him.

He will use the loan to buy a cement mixer, a tile cutter and to add to his work tools.  He is a hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy a cement mixer, a tile cutter and to add to his work tools.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: El señor Eleuterio se dedica a la cría de ganado lechero  y es productor lechero; el crédito lo utilizará para la compra de una vaca lechera de buena calidad para mejorar su volumen de producción de leche; también es albañil constructor y su esposa le ayuda con las actividades agrícolas, tienen cinco  hijos   y estas actividades son la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir gastos de su familia. Vive  en casa  propia ubicada en la Localidad de Akerana en la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz. Es la primera vez que obtiene un préstamo en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Eleuterio's business is raising dairy cows.  He is a milk producer.  He will use his loan to buy a good-quality dairy cow to improve the volume of milk he produces.

Eleuterio is also a builder and his wife helps him with his farm work.  They have five children and these business activities are their source of income which they use to cover their family expenses.

Eleuterio lives in his own home which is located in the town of Akerana, in Omasuyos province, in La Paz department.  This is the first time that he has had a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production and improve his income

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: El señor Fernando es albañil constructor y su esposa tiene un puesto de venta de verduras. Con el crédito comprará material de construcción para refaccionar su vivienda. Fernando tiene siete hijos y vive  en casa  propia ubicada en la Zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron ya que lo ayudan a mejorar la calidad  de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando is a bricklayer and his wife has a stand selling vegetables.  He will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies to do some home improvements.

Fernando has seven children and lives in his own house located in La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.  He is very satisfied with the loans he’s been granted because they help him improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies for home improvements.

loans.name: Kanyegaramire Tukwatanise, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
N. Sam is the leader of Kanyegaramire Tukwatanise, Kihihi group. He is 29 years old and married with two children. Sam has a business of selling produce from Nyamirima trading centre. He has been operating this business since past five years and makes weekly profits of UGX 90,000. Sam is also a Grade II teacher from which he earns additional income.
