He deals in both food and cash crops, some of which he grows himself. He used his first salary to start the produce selling business and later got a loan and hence the development. He is very hard-working and determined and wishes for a brighter future for his children. He needs a loan to buy more produce for resale.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale

loans.name: Maria Asunciona

texts.es:
María tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto familia en el distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella trabaja como empleada desde hace tres años  en una empresa agroindustrial ubicada en el distrito de Jayanca a 20 minutos del distrito de Motupe.  El tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad le ha permitido ayudar a su madre y solventar sus gastos económicos. María desea mejorar su vivienda y solventar sus gastos personales, de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo.

Ella es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores de la zona en donde reside. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
María, 43, is single living with her family in Motupe district; a farming zone belonging to Lambayeque province located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been employed for the last three years at an agro industrial firm located in Jayanca district, twenty minutes form Motupe district.  The time she’s been working has made it possible for her to help her mother and cover expenses.  

María would like to improve her dwelling and pay some personal expenses thus improving her quality of life.  Because of this she has thought it convenient to request an 1800 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternative that will help her reach her objective.

She is quite well known and liked by the residents of the area where she lives.  People who know her consider her to be level-headed and quite responsible.

loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a member of Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, in the Goshen Amani group. She joined the group as a businesswoman who runs a poultry business. She started this business six years ago; she was previously selling clothes for a living. Alice has also managed to build rental houses through Faulu Kenya. She hopes to build more rental houses in the future. With her loan of 50,000 KES, she will buy chickens for her poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for her farm

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Doña Ángela se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 16 años que tiene este negocio, negocio que ella misma atiende todos los días, y con mucho ánimo y el buen trato ha hecho que su establecimiento sea el más concurrido Una de las cualidades que cree poseer, es el orden que siempre lleva en sus cuentas y eso le permite saber cuánto gana por cada producto que vende. Es por ello que desea tener una tienda más llena de mercadería y muy variada. Este crédito es para comprar calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos, sabanas entre otros productos.
texts.en: Doña Ángela sells general goods. She has run this business every day for more than 16 years, and with a great deal of energy and good service she has made her establishment the busiest. One of the qualities that she believes herself to have is order, which she uses in her accounts, allowing her to know how much she earns from each product that she sells. Consequently, she wants to have a better stocked shop with a wide variety of products. This loan is to buy shoes, clothing in general, cosmetics, and sheets among other products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy scrap metals

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 37 años es una esforzada madre soltera de 3 hijos; a los que cuida y educa con mucho esmero, pues son su razón de vivir. Juntos viven en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el caserío de Huallquin. El trabajo al que se dedica está esforzada mujer es la “agricultura”. Desde que tenía 20 años, comenzó a producir la tierra sembrando papa, arveja y olluco, los que después de fertilizarlos, limpiarlos y cosecharlos, son vendidos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Pero durante los meses que están sembrados sus productos, ella se dedica a la venta de papa por kilos en las ferias que se realizan en el mercado modelo de Tarma, cada jueves y domingo. Las ganas de salir delante de está mujer son impresionantes, y ve en sus limitaciones la motivación de salir adelante para poder sacar profesionales a sus hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer renovado”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde es una socia muy querida, por su trabajo y responsabilidad. Gladys cosechará papa de la variedad “yungay”, por ello con el crédito comprará 6 sacos de abono orgánico los cuales esparcirá entre sus sembríos para su próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Gladys, 37 years old, is a courageous single mother with three children, who she cares for and educates with great care - they are her reason for living. They all live together in her parents' house in the hamlet of Huallquin. This spirited woman works in agriculture. Twenty years ago she began to work the land sowing potatoes, peas and ullucos; after fertilizing them, washing them and harvesting them, they are then sold in the city's wholesale market.
Yet, during the months when her products have already been sown, she sells kilos of potatoes at the market fairs in Tarma every Thursday and Sunday. This woman's desire to make ends meet is impressive, and her ultimate motivation is to get by and make her children into professional people. She belongs to the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer Renovado", and this is her sixth loan with MFP, where she is a well liked member for her work and her sense of responsibility. Gladys will sow the "Yungay" variety of potato, for which she will use the loan to buy 6 sacks of organic fertilizer to scatter over her fields when they are sown for the next harvest.

loans.use: To purchase six sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Distrito 8 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento "Distrito 8" se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de L. Institución, compuesto por 13 personas de los cuales dos son varones,  sus actividades están entre venta de ropa, sabanas, edredones, fotógrafos y promotoras de cosméticos, son de L. zona del Plan 3000 El grupo se fundo por L. iniciativa de L. Sra. Mary quien es L. presidenta, que se dedica a L. venta de ropa al crédito, L. que distribuye entre sus amistades y vecinos, elL. realiza sus compra los miércoles y sábados ya que compra por docena en L. feria de Barrio Lindo, por este motivo solicito el crédito para comprar ropa por docenas.  L. Sra. Consuelo es L. tesorera tiene 24 años elL. es soltera aún no tiene hijos pero ya cuenta con su negocio de venta de ropa y eventualmente también vende cosméticos, elL. es una persona muy carismática y sobre todo emprendedora  ya vende las cosas de temporada, cuando no esta vendiendo ropa busca electrodomésticos y materiales escolares para vender, elL. vive en L. casa de sus padres a los que ayuda, elL. sueña con poder juntar de a poco dinero para poder comprar su lote y luego poder independizarse, con el dinero del crédito comprar mercadería en cosméticos que se encuentra en liquidación. Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidos con L. institución  por el apoyo brindado, una de las socias no esta en L. foto ya que elL. esta sacando L. foto.
texts.en:
The "Distrito 8" community bank is in its first loan cycle with the institution.  The bank has 13 members, 2 of whom are men.  The members' business activities include selling clothes, sheets and comforters; photography and selling cosmetics.  They are all from Plan 3000 neighborhood.  The group was founded by Mary who is the group's president.  Her business is selling clothes on credit to her friends and neighbors.  She buys her products on Wednesdays and Saturdays.  She buys her products in bulk in Barrio Lindo market.  She is requesting this loan to buy clothes in bulk.

Consuelo is the bank's treasurer.  She is 24 years old, single, and doesn't have any children yet.  However, she already owns her own business selling clothes and eventually she will also sell cosmetics.  She is a very charismatic person and, above all, enterprising.  She sells seasonal products.  When she is not selling clothes she looks for electrical appliances and school supplies to sell.  Consuelo lives in her parents' home and helps them.  She dreams of being able to put a little money aside so that she can buy a plot of land and become independent.  She will use her loan money to buy cosmetics that are on sale.  All the members of her community bank are responsible and hard-working people who are grateful to the institution for the support they have offered them.  One of the bank's members is not in the photo as she is taking the photo.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Pitahaya Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pitaya está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Antonia del Carmen M. desde hace 5 años se dedica al comercio de plátanos y maní en el M. de Masaya. Ella con el crédito comprará mayor cantidad de plátanos y maní.
Las otras integrantes son Jeissel María B. quien vende cosméticos en la zona franca desde hace 5 años y Maria Auxiliadora Mejía tiene una pequeña pulpería donde vende golosinas, gaseosas y granos básicos.
texts.en:
The “Pitaya” (Red Pitaya) group is composed of three, hard working women. One of them is Antonia del Carmen M. who’s been selling bananas and peanuts for the past five years in Masaya’s market.  She will use the loan to buy larger amounts of bananas and peanuts.

The other group members are Jeissel María B. who has sold cosmetics in the tax-free zone for five years now and María Auxiliadora Mejía who has a small grocery store selling sweets, soft drinks and basic grains.

loans.use: For bananas and peanuts.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 33 years old and a member of Jobowisa group in Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. He is married and blessed with a four-year-old child. He sells vehicle spares parts to earn a living. John has been running this business for 11 years; before this, he was working as a mechanic. He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because he has learned how to keep business records through training it has provided, which has enabled him to improve his business. He is a hardworking man who hopes to open other outlets for his business in the future. With his loan of 50,000 KES, he will buy more spare parts for resale.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for resale

loans.name: Marcos Augusto

texts.es: El señor Marcos Augusto tiene 28 años,  este señor tiene 5 hijos que todavía estudian. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de tricitaxi. El dio inicio hace 4 años, y poco a poco ha logro comprar su propio tricitaxi, para ofrecerles a sus clientes un buen servicio. Sus sueños son de mantener activo su negocio y de darle mejoras a su vivienda ya que esta es una de las prioridades que él tiene debido a que sus hijos están creciendo y necesita ofrecerle un espacio que sea propiedad de ellos. Ahora solicita la ayuda de Fundación León 2000 el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para proporcionarle reparación mantenimiento a su medio de transporte.
texts.en:
Marcos Augusto, 28, has five children still in school.  His economic activity is providing mototaxi services.  He started four years ago and gradually managed to purchase his own mototaxi to provide his customers with good service.  His dream is to keep his business active and provide some home improvements which is one of his priorities because his children are growing and he needs to provide proper space for them.

He is asking help from Fundación León.  The loan will be for working capital to provide maintenance and repair to his means of transport.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Alianza Group

texts.es: El banco de Emprendimiento "ALIANZA " es uno grupo  nuevo de la agencia, se encuentra en su primer ciclo., el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco  esta representada por las siguientes socias: Presidenta la Sra. Mabel  quien es la líder del grupo, tiene como negocio la venta de mercaderías por temporada actual mente se esta dedicando a la venta de material escolar, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de material escolar. Como Tesorera esta la Sra. Guillermina  es separada con dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y tiene como negocio de venta de comida en su domicilio y con el dinero del crédito comprara abarrotes como fideo, arroz, etc. Para la elaboración de sus comidas, la Secretaria es la Sra. Mayra es casada con un hijo quien se dedica a la confección y venta de material deportivo, es una persona joven y activa, con el dinero del crédito comparara telas e hilos para confección de sus prendas de vestir. Todas las integrantes de este banco solicitan el crédito para incremento de capital de trabajo, son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en mucho caso sacan adelante a sus familias solas, y estan profudandamente agradecida a la institucion por el poyo brindado.
texts.en:
The “ALIANZA” (Alliance) communal bank is a new group in the agency.  It’s in its first cycle.  It’s composed of responsible, hard working people.  The bank is represented by the following members: 

Mabel, President, is the group leader.  She sells seasonal items so is currently selling school supplies.  She will use the loan to buy school supplies.

Guillermina is Treasurer.  She’s separated and has two school age children.  Her business is home-based food sales located in the La Chimba zone.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients like noodles, rice, etc. to make her dishes.

Mayra is the Secretary.  She is married and has a son.  She makes sportswear to sell.  She is a young, active person and will use the money to buy fabric and thread to make her items of clothing.  All of the group members are asking for the loan for capital increase.They are all responsible and hard working people who in many cases support their families alone, and are profoundly grateful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 48 years old and a member of Light Brothers group in Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. He does printing and sells stationery to earn a living.  He has been engaged in this business for three years. Being a married man with four children in school, he works hard to provide for them. He has gained a lot from joining Faulu Kenya, including saving his money, sharing business ideas with his group members and accessing loans easily. Bernard has requested a second loan of 50,000 KES from Faulu Kenya. He will use the money to buy a computer monitor and printer.

loans.use: To buy a computer monitor and printer

loans.name: Asociación Sin Frontera Group

texts.es:
El grupo Asociación sin frontera lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Felipa José E. quien vende verduras desde hace 20 años en Tipitapa municipio de Managua. Ella invertirá el crédito en naranjas, limones, papas y en especial repollo.

Las otras integrantes de grupo como Socorro Rodríguez quien vende papel a las comiderias el cual utilizan para servir la comida y Lidia P. Solano vende ropa, zapatos…etc. desde hace 20 años.
texts.en:
The “Sin Frontera” (Without Borders) group is composed of three, hard working, enterprising women.  One of them is Felipa José E. who has been selling vegetables in Tipitapa, Managua, for the last 20 years.  She will use the money to buy oranges, lemons, potatoes and especially, cabbage.

The other group members are Socorro Rodríguez who sells paper used to serve meals to eateries and Lidia P. Solano who has sold clothes, shoes, etc. for the past 20 years.

loans.use: For vegetables like oranges, lemons, potatoes and especially cabbage.

loans.name: Ober

texts.es: Ober, de 28 años, es un hombre responsable y cumplido. Vive en compañía de su esposa Noemí y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Desde joven aprendió el trabajo agrícola, desde entonces siembra papa, olluco (tubérculos), productos que constantemente fertiliza, y en la que su esposa los cuida con mucha dedicación; obteniendo así una buena cosecha que son comercializados en el mercado central de su ciudad. Sin embargo hace medio año que incursionó en el negocio de compra y venta de frutas, en un mercado de la capital del país,  según menciona los días de mayor venta son los martes, viernes y domingos, ya que la venta es gran proporción de diferentes frutas que se producen en la selva del Perú. Ante esto, desea comprar un terreno en el mismo mercado, para iniciar con este negocio de frutas y no tener que pagar alquiler. Él pertenece al grupo comunal “nuevo amanecer renovado”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, y como único hombre, es responsable y trabajador. Ober, maneja un capital diario de 2 mil a 3 mil soles, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar toda variedad de frutas para su comercialización.
texts.en:
Ober, 28, is a responsible, dependable man living with his wife, Noemí, and their two children in a rented house located in the city of Tarma.  Since a young age he learned farming and since then has farmed potato and olluco (a tuber), products he constantly fertilizes and his wife cares for very diligently thereby obtaining a good harvest that’s sold in his city’s central market.  However, half a year ago he went into buying and selling fruit in a market in the nation’s capital.  According to what he tells us, the days of greatest sales are Tuesdays, Fridays and Sundays because sales consist, in large measure, in fruits produced in Perú’s jungle.  Because of this, he wants to buy a space in that same market to start this fruit business and not have to pay rent.

He is a member of the “Nuevo Amanecer Renovado” (New Renewed Dawn) and this is his fifth loan with MFP.  As the only male member, he is responsible and hard working.  Ober handles a daily capital of around 2000 to 3000 soles so he’s planning on using the loan to buy a great variety of fruit to sell.

loans.use: To buy fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Sergia

texts.es:
María es una madre D. familia D. 49 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el caserío San Martín del distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización D. ganado ovino, ella cría su ganado en la parte posterior D. su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donD. resiD., en algunos casos los sacrifica y venD. su carne. Adicionalmente ella venD. productos D. belleza por catalogo a las personas D. la zona.

María desea adquirir alimento balanceado para su ganado ya que la demanda esta aumentando asimismo adquirir más productos D. belleza. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is a 49-year-old mother who lives with her husband and two children in the rural community San Martín in the agricultural district of TambogranD., an agricultural area located in the Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

María raises and sells sheep. She raises her livestock behind her house, and when they have reached a good stage of development she offers them to the businesspeople who visit the area where she lives. In some cases she slaughters them and sells their meat. In addition, she sells beauty products by catalog to people in the area.

María wishes to buy animal feed for her livestock because demand is increasing as well as buy more beauty products. That is why she thought it would be a good idea to request a loan of 2000 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase animal feed for her livestock

loans.name: Cupesi Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento Cupesi compuesto por Nueve Personas. La Sra. Rebeca  es la presidenta del banco, se dedica a la venta de Ropa, tiene 22 años. Vive en el Barrio  Cupesi, de ahí el nombre del banco, desde muy temprana edad ella aprendio el negocio  de la venta de ropa y otros, pues su madre se dedica  a todo tipo de negocio, estudia  y trabaja por las mañanas en decoraciones de eventos, ella entrega su ropa en oficinas y el distintos domicilios, Es una persona con muchas ganas de superación, con el dinero del crédito comprara ropa por cantidad. La Sra. Zimara  es la tesorera tiene 19 Años, se dedica a la venta de Cosméticos tiene un Bebe de Un año, Hace tres Años que se dedica a la venta del mismo, otras veces sale a trabajar lavando ropa, ya que su marido   realiza jornales como Albañil, son personas que alquilan pues tienen que batallar la vida para el bienestar de su familia, con el dinero del crédito comprar cosméticos que se encuentran en promoción, Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidos con la institución  por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The Cupesi Communal Bank is made up of nine people. Mrs. Rebeca is the president of the bank; she is 22 years old and sells clothing. She lives in the Cupesi neighborhood, which the bank is named after. From a very early age, she learned the business of selling clothes and other things, since her mother did all kinds of business. She studies and works in the mornings decorating for events. She delivers her clothing to offices and various residences. She has a strong desire to succeed, and with the money from the loan she will buy large quantities of clothing. Mrs. Zimara is the treasurer. She is 19 years old, sells cosmetics, and has a one-year-old baby. She has been selling cosmetics for three years; other times she works washing clothing. Her husband works days as a construction worker. They are renters, since they have to fight for their family's well-being. With the money from the loan she will buy cosmetics that are on special offer. All the members are responsible, hard-working people who are grateful for the support offered by the organization.

loans.use: Purchase of Clothing by the dozen

loans.name: Donal

texts.es: Donal tiene  65 años, vive con su esposa en el municipio de Somotillo. La actividad económica de Donal es brindar el servicio de  fotocopiadora y venta de folder. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Está ubicado en el guasaule, el negocio nació cuando se encontraba en momentos difíciles económicamente y además sus hijos tenían que estudiar y fue esto lo que le llevo a tomar la decisión de establecer este medio de vida. Sus propósitos son de incrementar su inventario. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de papel, tinta, reparación de fotocopiadoras entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Donal is 65 years old and lives with his wife in the municipality of Somotillo. Donal offers photocopying services and sells folders. He has had this business for more than five years. It is located in Guasaule. The business was born when he found himself in a time of financial difficulty and, in addition, his children had to study. This made him decide to establish this way of life. He plans to increase his inventory. The loan will be used for working capital to purchase paper, ink, and repair photocopiers, among other things.

loans.use: Working capital: purchase paper and ink, repair photocopiers, etc.

loans.name: El Quesillo Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Quesillo está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Rosa Carolina L.  quien se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace varios años e invertirá el crédito en mercadería en especial blusas ya que tiene mayor demanda.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Gladys Vásquez quien tiene una tortillería hace 8 años y Rosa E. Calero quien vende ropa desde hace 8 años.
texts.en:
The “El Quesillo” group is made up of three, hard working people.  One of them is Rosa Carolina L. who has sold clothes for several years.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise, especially blouses, because they are in highest demand.

The other group members are Gladys Vásquez who has had a tortilla ship for 8 years and Rosa E. Calero who has sold clothes for the last 8 years.

loans.use: For clothing.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, D. 57 años, es una D. aquellas mujeres que cuidan D. la armonía D. los suyos. Junto a su esposo Santos cuidaron D. sus 9 hijos, los que ahora ya son mayores, pero constantemente visitan a sus padres en el caserío D. Huallquin, que es lugar donD. viven. Como buena mujer del campo; ella se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Sus 30 años D. experiencia le enseñaron a trabajar con ahínco para poder obtener buenas ganancias. Sus principales sembríos constan D. habas, arveja, olluco y papa, los que después D. cada cosecha; comercializa en el mercado mayorista D. su ciudad. Asimismo las 7 vacas que posee le brindan buena leche, con lo que hace un promedio D. 35 quesos a la semana, los cuales lleva a una tienda reconocida D. la ciudad. Ahora ella desea aumentar la producción D. leche D. sus vacas y D. esa manera obtener mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer renovado”, y este es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP, donD. es una tesorera responsable y cumplida. Juana, esparcirá entre sus terrenos agrícola semillas D. pasto, para que se alimenten las vacas que posee, asimismo invertirá en la compra D. una nueva vaca lechera.
texts.en:
Juana, 57, is one of those women who always see that her loved ones are in harmony.  Together with her husband, Santos, they cared for their nine children who are all now adults who constantly visit their parents in Huallquin which is where they live. 

Like a good woman of the land, she farms and raises animals.  Her 30 years experience has taught her to work with dedication to obtain good profits.  Her main crops are lima beans, peas, olluco (a tuber) and potatoes which she sells in her city’s wholesale market once harvested.  In addition, the seven cows she has produce good milk with which she makes, on average, 35 cheeses per week that she takes to a well-known store in the city.  She wants to increase her cows’ milk production to earn better profits.

She is a member of the “Nuevo Amanecer Renovado” (New Renewed Dawn) communal bank and this is her 6th loan with MFP where she is a responsible, dependable Treasurer.  

Juana will spread grass seed throughout her fields so that the cows she has can something to eat; she will also buy a new dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy pasturage seed so her cows can eat; she will also buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Victorio Group

texts.es: El banco D. Emprendimiento "VICTORI0 " es uno grupo  nuevo D. la agencia, se encuentra en su primer ciclo., el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco  esta representada por las siguientes socias: Presidenta la señora Zulma quien es la líder del grupo, tiene como negocio la venta y preparación D. comida para eventos especiales, casada tiene 2 hijos, el destino del crédito será para el aumento D. su capital. Como Tesorera esta la Sra. Lisbeth quien es casada, tiene 3 hijos, su actividad económica es la  venta D. cosméticos y comida su crédito lo destinara para el aumento D. su capital  y la Secretaria es la Sra. Daniela es soltera quien se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, es una persona joven y activa y su el crédito lo destinara para aumento D. capital. Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidos con la institución  por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The communal bank "Victorio" is a group that is new to the institution; it is in its first loan cycle.  It is maD. up of responsible and hardworking people.  This bank includes the members described below.  Zulma is the president and leader of the group, she has a business preparing and selling meals for special events.  She is married with 2 children, and she will use this loan to increase her working capital.  Lisbeth, the treasurer, is married, has 3 children and has a business selling cosmetics and food.  She will use this loan to increase her working capital.  Daniela, the secretary, is single and has a business selling cosmetics.  She is an active young person, and will use the loan to increase her capital.  All of the members are responsible and hardworking people who are grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: INCREMENTO DE CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo es un padre de familia de 41 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Cruce Jaén ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Guillermo se dedica a brindar servicio de mantenimiento de vehículos en un local ubicado cerca a su domicilio, donde ofrece su servicio de enllante, limpieza, entre otros a todos los vecinos y comerciantes que visitan la zona. El ya tiene siete años dedicándose a esta actividad contando con clientela fidelizada y gracias a ella solventa los gastos económicos de su familia.

El desea realizar comprar herramientas que utiliza para la reparación de los vehículos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Guillermo es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus amigos, ellos lo consideran alguien responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a 41 year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the rural Cruce Jaen settlement, located in the Olmos district.  This is an agricultural area that also has quite a bit of commercial activity.  It is part of the Lambayeque province, located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Guillermo has a business providing auto maintenance and repair services in a place that is located close to his home.  There he offers his customers tire services, vehicle cleaning, and other services.  His customers are neighbors and tradesmen who visit his area.  He has already spent 7 years in this line of work, and so has a regular customer base.  Thanks to this business he is able to pay for his family's expenses.

He wants to buy tools for repairing vehicles.  To do this he is requesting, for the first time, a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles.

Guillermo is held in high esteem by his friends; they consider him to be a responsible person who has a strong desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy tools for his business

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida V. P.  de 39 años vive en la Urbanizaciòn la Playa muy cerca al mar;  en ese ambiente de playa brisa y mar, se desempeña en su negocio dedicado a la comercializaciòn de productos mediante guias especializadas y de mercancia que le encargan sus clientes y que no aparecen en el catalogo de su oferta, como perfumes, utiles escolares, calzado, ropa femenina, masculina e infantil y en general todo lo que le piden sus buenos clientes.
Su negocio inicò hace cuatro años, cuando aun no estaba inscrita en las empresas que ofrecen productos por catalogos y en ese moemento lo hacia a travès de una amiga, pero gradualmente crecieron sus clientes y se independizò, agregando muchas otras mercanicas que no tenian las guias especializadas de productos y tambien se inscribiò en diversas revistas, para comercializar varios tipos de mercancia.
Este es su tercer crédito con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo y su primer credikiva, con el cual planea comprar utiles escolares, aprovechando que es la época en que los colegios inician sus clases y estos  productos tienen muy alta rotaciòn; con esta inversiòn augura su èxito porque sus clientes, padres de familia, satisfacen la apremiante  necesidad de dotar a sus hijos con libros, cuadernos, lapices reglas, etc  necesarios para lograr su aprovechamiento escolar.  Asi mismo Aida  tambien venderá uniformes y calzados para estudiantes, pues ella los  comprará  en mayor volumen obteniendo  buenos descuentos que posteriormente venderà  a padres de familia  mediante el sistema de crèdito, el cual facilita el acceso a la educaciòn de sus hijos.
Desde que iniciò su financiamiento con la Fundaciòn ha obtenido logros en su negocio, como el de  conseguir utilidades que le facilitan aportar a su hogar y sobre todo tener un capital adicional al suyo, para responder a la demanda de sus clientes. 
Su mayor desafio es lograr tener un almacen, para prosicionar su negocio, aumentar sus utilidades y seguir mejorando las condiciones  de vida familiar, pues  ella y su conyuge se esfuerzan y trabajan para que sus cuatro hijos, en las edades de 4 a 20 años, logren la prosperidad y el èxito derivado de una educaciòn de calidad y mejores opciones laborales futuras.
texts.en:
Aida V. P., 39, lives in the La Playa development, very near the ocean.  In that ambience of sea breezes and the ocean she undertakes her work selling catalogue merchandise and other items not in catalogues that her customers order from her like perfumes, school supplies, shoes, clothing for women, men and children and, in general, whatever her good customers request.

The business started four years ago when she still wasn’t enrolled with any of the catalogue firms; at that time she did it through a friend.  Gradually her customer base grew and she became independent adding a lot more merchandise that wasn’t included in the catalogues and she also subscribed to several magazines in order to sell all kinds of merchandise.

This is her 3rd loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her first with Kiva.  She plans to use it to buy school supplies taking advantage of the season in which schools restart classes and these products are quick sellers.  This investment bodes success because her customers, parents, can satisfy the pressing need to supply their children with books, notebooks, pencils, rulers, etc. needed to do well in school.  In addition, Aida will also sell school uniforms and shoes for students because she’ll buy them in large quantities and then offer generous discounts.  She will sell them to the parents on credit which will make their children’s access to education easier.

Since starting financing through the Fundación she’s reached goals in her business, like earning profits to contribute to her home and, above all, having additional capital of her own to respond to customer demand.

Her greatest challenge is to have a warehouse, to position her business in the marketplace, to increase profits and to continue improving her family’s conditions because she and her spouse work hard and make the effort so that their four children, ranging in ages between 4 and 20, will attain prosperity and success, derived from a quality education, and better future employment options.

loans.use: To buy school supplies, uniforms and shoes to sell to students.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es: La Sra. Marianela de 25 años de edad casada hace más de dos  años y medio con el Sr. Alexander tiene un hijo, viven en casa propia en el en la localidad de el Torno. La clienta tiene su vehículo el cual lo da a trabajar para taxi y ella percibe una renta diaria que le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, la Sra.  Marianela trabaja como, secretaria  lleva ya con eta actividad varios años,  El crédito que solicito la Sra. Marianela es para la compra de una moto. La clienta expreso su agradecimiento a la Institución por  la rapidez que fueron atendidos y el buen trato que se le dio.
texts.en:
Marianela, 25, has been married to Alexander for more than two and a half years; she has a son.  They live in a house of their own in El Torno.  She owns a vehicle that she leases out to provide taxi services; she is paid a daily rental fee that helps her meet household expenses. Marianela has been employed as a Secretary for several years.

The loan Marianela asked for is to buy a motorcycle.  She expressed her gratitude to the Institution for the speed with which she was taken care of and for the good way she was treated.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For truck repair and to buy livestock to sell.

loans.name: Mario Alfonso

texts.es:
Mario T., está aplicando a su quinto credito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y a su  segundo credikiva porque se surtirá de útiles escolares  como libretas, lápices, colores, bolígrafos, cartulinas y bloques de papel carta y oficio; así mismo comprará repuestos como toma corriente, balineras, bovinas y aletas para abanicos, todo esto en términos  de satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes, lo cual garantiza que su inversión sea exitosa. Su meta y gran desafío es tener una vivienda propia y en este propósito él y su esposa, quien aparece en la fotografía, se esfuerzan mucho  trabajando para lograr conseguirlo.
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Mario ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/173600
texts.en:
Mario T. is applying for his fifth Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, second Kiva loan to stock up on school supplies like notebooks, pencils, crayons, ball point pens, construction paper and reams of letter and legal size paper as well as to buy parts like plugs, ball bearings, ignition coils and fan blades in order to fill customer orders thus guaranteeing a successful investment.

His goal and great challenge is to have his own house and this is his and his wife’s, who appears in the photo, purpose.  They exert much effort to work hard to attain it.

If you’d like to know Mario’s history, please click on the following link:

http://kiva.org/lend/173600

loans.use: To buy school supplies like notebooks, pencils, crayons, ball point pens, construction paper, reams of letter and legal size paper as well as electrical parts like plugs, ball bearings, ignition coils and blades for fans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Elio

texts.es:
Elio tiene 35 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío La Estancia ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial, conocida como la capital del limón a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace más de tres años, él siembra maracuyá y limón en un pequeño terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta, durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo de cultivos. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar la economía diaria de su familia.

 Elio desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento de plantación a su cultivo de maracuyá, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Elio es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Elio is 35 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the village of La Estancia in the District of Olmos. This farming district experiences significant commercial activity and is known as the “the lemon capital”. The community is more than an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Elio has worked in farm-related activities for more than three years. He grows passion fruit and lemons on a small plot of land that he owns. Throughout this time, he has learned a great deal about managing his crops. The revenue he generates from his farming activities is used to cover his family’s daily needs.

Elio wants to acquire fertilizers so that he can maintain his passion fruit crop. By taking this action, he hopes to achieve a good harvest. For this reason, he has found it necessary to request a loan of 2000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

Elio is a peaceful and responsible individual. His greatest wish is to grow as an entrepreneur and move forward.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for his passion fruit crop

loans.name: John Carlos

texts.es: John Carlos García es un joven de 26 años que vive en el barrio los Trupillos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, allí se dedica a la venta de productos de ferretería como productos PVC, cables de electricidad, puntillas, tuercas, lijas y soldadura  al por mayor, que le compra a un distribuidor en Bogotá, la capital de Colombia, y le vende  a distintas ferreterías de la ciudad de Barranquilla; esta actividad la inició  cuando, después de cuatro años de experiencia como dependiente de una empresa ferretera, decidió independizarse para  iniciar su propio negocio.  Su sueño es tener una gran central de acopio para distribuir estas mercancías  desde allí, pero necesita mucho capital de trabajo para ello y justamente este es su gran desafío. Con su primer financiamiento en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el comprará productos en P.V.C. que es su articulo principal y tambien de electricidad,  para responder a  encargos y porque estos son de mayor rotación; con su credikiva aprovechará las ofertas que se han generado en este mes, en el que las plataformas comerciales tienen muy  baja rotación de estos productos y los ofrecen a buenos precios.   John Carlos maneja su negocio mediante  ventas de contado principalmente y a crédito que recupera semanalmente, estas últimas es donde  reposa mayormente su cartera, la cual  recupera mensualmente, mientras persiste con su sueño de lograr crecimiento  empresarial y personal para potenciar el futuro exitoso  de su familia.
texts.en:
John Carlos G., ages 26, is a young man who lives in the neighborhood of Trupillos in the city of Barranquilla. There he sells hardware products such as PVC, electrical cables, nails, screws, sandpaper, and welding supplies at wholesale. He purchases these products from a distributor in Bogota, the capital of Colombia, and sells them to different hardware stores in the city of Barranquilla. John Carlos started this business after he gained four years of experience working for a company that sold hardware. He decided to become independent so that he could start his own business. His dream is to have a large centralized warehouse from which he could distribute his merchandise, but he needs plenty of operating capital to do this. The lack of capital is his greatest challenge.

With his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, John Carlos will buy PVC products since this is the main item he sells, as well as electrical supplies, so that he can fulfill his orders. These products also have high turnover. With his Kiva loan, he will also take advantage of bids being generated this month at commercial auctions where products that have low turnover are being offered at good prices. John Carlos manages his business mainly through cash sales and credit payments he collects on a weekly basis. Lately most of the cash stays in his wallet while he tries to recover payments each month. He continues to pursue his dream of having a growing business and reaching his personal potential so that his family can be successful in the future.

loans.use: Purchase PVC products & electrical supplies in bulk

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 45 años; es una luchadora madre soltera. Vive junto a su hijo Jefferson en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Huallquin. Una mujer muy trabajadora, sale todos los días al campo para fertilizar los cultivos de papa, olluco y habas que siembra pero en pocas cantidades. Pero la principal actividad de Juana, es la ganadería, tiene 4 vacas y 2 becerros, que le brindan 6 litros de leche diarios con lo que realiza queso; productos que son vendidos en feria dominical que se realiza en la ciudad de Tarma. Como el lugar donde vive, es muy frígido, está pensando comprar cobertizos para que su ganado este abrigado. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer renovado”, y este es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una presidenta líder. María, constantemente compra vitaminas para que sus vacas le produzcan buena leche; por ello con el crédito comprará 3 baldes de “sal-lecherita”, un concentrado que estos animales toman todos los días.
texts.en: Juana is 45 years old and is a determined single mother.  She lives with her son, Jefferson, in a house that she owns in the rural settlement of Huallquin.  She is a very hardworking woman and goes out to the fields every day to fertilize her potato, ‘olluco’ (an Andean tuber) and bean crops that she grows in small quantities.  However, Juana’s main work is in cattle farming.  She has four cows and two calves that produce six liters of milk daily, which she then uses to make cheese to sell at the Sunday market in the city of Tarma.  Because the area where she lives is very cold, she is thinking of buying sheds so that her cattle are kept warm.  She belongs to the Nuevo Amanecer Renovado Communal Bank and this is her fifth loan with MFP, where she is president.  She constantly buys vitamins so that her cows produce good quality milk.  This is why she will use the loan to purchase three buckets of ‘sal-lecherita’ – a concentrate that the animals drink every day.

loans.use: To purchase buckets of a nutritional substance for the cows so that they can produce better milk

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan Ramón P. Mora, tiene la edad de 46 años, está casado y tiene 6 hijos que son su mayor prioridad al igual que su señora esposa. El con el dinero pretende comprar chatarra a personas particulares y luego venderla a las exportadores de estos recurso para su fundición. El tiene varios años de dedicarse a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien por lo cual pretende aumentar la cantidad de estos materiales a su posesión y asi a la hora de venderlos seran mayores las ganancias. El pretender brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y seguir para adelante con sus metas como persona y jefe de hogar.
Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  ha tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales como el Banco de Costa Rica, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón P. Mora is 46 years old, married, and has six children. His wife and children are his highest priority. He intends to use this loan to buy scrap metal from individuals that he can later sell to exporters who supply these materials for smelting. Juan has been in this business for several years and has done very well. He is looking to increase the amount of these materials in his possession so that he can generate more profit. Juan wants to provide his family with a better quality of life and move forward with his goals as a person and as a head of household.

This is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has had previous loans with state banks such as the Bank of Costa Rica, but FUDECOSUR is offering this loan with better services and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: Purchase scrap metal for eventual resale

loans.name: Yuris Mercedes

texts.es:
Yuris H.  de 30 años de dad es una mujer emprendedora y es abogada de profesión, actividad que ha ejercido muy poco para poder dedicarse al cuidado y la educación personal de su familia, compuesta por su  cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 8 años, mientras desarrolla una actividad comercial que  se lo ha permitido. Allí en el barrio 7 de Agosto del municipio de Puerto Colombia, muy cerca al mar, lugar donde vive y es bien conocida por su gran carisma, Yuris tiene una miscelánea donde vende productos de papelería, accesorios femeninos,  perfumes calcetines, calzado y ropa interior infantil, el cual  inició hace dos años  con  muy poca mercancía y una vitrina; a ello ha ido agregando artículos que sus clientes pieden y  que inicialmente ella no tenia;  así  mismo adicionó 3 vitrinas mas, para lograr tener su mercancia en orden y  bien exhibida, como en la actualidad  muestra su miscelánea. Cariñosamente Yuris comenta, que como en Puerto Colombia es muy comun la organización de bingos para recolectar fondos sociales y personales, ella ha especializado su miscelanea,  en la venta de los regalos bien empacados que sortean en esta actividad.  Recientemente se ha iniciado la jornadas académicas del país y han ingresado a los establecimientos educativos los estudiantes, razón por la cual se ha incrementado la demanda de útiles escolares, como fólderes, libretas, agendas, bolígrafos y papelería en general, y para responder a esa demanda  está solicitando su credikiva,  que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual surtirá su negocio con los mencionados artículos. 
Yuris es una emprendedora que siempre está en la búsqueda de ofertas y de los mejores precios para impactar positivamente a sus clientes en su propio mercado y para que estos la refieran a otros compradores.  Su sueño es  independizar su espacio laboral del empresarial y está en la búsqueda  de una mejor vivienda donde pueda hacerlo,  mientras goza de unas ventas mensuales que le ayudan a sostener sus gastos familiares,  al lado de su cónyuge que la acompaña en sus proyectos y que la inspira para alcanzar  los logros que ella obtiene.
texts.en:
Yuris H., age 30, is a lawyer by profession but practiced her career very little so that she could take care of her family full-time and provide for their education. Her family consists of her husband and their two children, ages 3 and 8. Yuris lives in the August 7th neighborhood of the town of Puerto Colombia, which is very close to the sea. She is known for her charismatic personality and manages a gift shop where she sells stationery, women’s accessories, perfumes, stockings, shoes, and undergarments for infants. Yuris started this business two years ago with very little merchandise and only one display cabinet. She keeps adding products requested by her customers which she did not have before. As a result, she acquired three more display cabinets so that she could keep her merchandise organized and prominently displayed like any good business should. With great affection, Yuris says that it is common in Puerto Colombia for people to organize bingo games as fundraisers for social and personal events. She has specialized in selling beautifully packaged gifts that can be used for these types of events. Recently she started attending academic conferences and established relationships with several schools. For this reason, she has experienced an increased demand in school supplies such as folders, notebooks, diaries, pens, and stationery. To keep up with demand, she is requesting a Kiva loan, which will be her first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. The funds will be used to restock her business with these items.

Yuris is an entrepreneur who always looks for offers and the best prices so that her customers will have a positive experience in her store and refer her to other buyers. Her dream is to relieve herself of her current work location and find a better place to operate her business. Meanwhile, she enjoys the monthly sales that help pay for the family expenses. Along with her husband, she continues to pursue her projects and is inspired by the goals she has already achieved.

loans.use: Purchase school supplies such as folders, notebooks, diaries, pens, and stationery

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 59 años y reside junto a su esposa e hijos en su casa propia en la parte rural del caserío La Pala ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola conocida como la capital del limón, que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a más una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace varios años, Santiago brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Transporte la gente en la ruta entre Olmos y sus caseríos. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura, él siembra maíz. Santiago desea realizar algunas mejoras a su vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo. También querría comprar algunos accesorios que necesita para mantener su moto en buenas condiciones y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y hacer algunos arreglos en su domicilio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Santiago is 59 years old and lives with his wife and children in his own home in the rural section of the town of La Pala, which is located in the District of Olmos. This farming district is known as “the lemon capital”, part of Lambayeque Province, and located more an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past several years Santiago has provided passenger transport services with his motorcycle taxi, a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used for carrying people. He transports people along a route between Olmos and the neighboring villages. Santiago also works as a farmer, growing corn. He wants to make a few repairs to his vehicle since it is the piece of equipment he uses for work. Santiago also wants to buy a few accessories that he needs to keep his motorcycle taxi in good condition so that he can continue providing good service. With the help of this loan, he hopes to increase his earnings and make some repairs to his home. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Primera Esperanza 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the group Primera Persona 2 & 3 ("First Person"). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three of her four children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build her house. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying her business.

Rosa is excited to be taking out her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for five years, starting with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to invest this loan in her business by buying perfume, cosmetics, underwear, etc. She will save the profits to pay for her children's transportation (they attend university in another city and they have to travel weekly).

Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, an area famous for agricultural activities and the rural scene. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy perfume, cosmetics, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria S. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de productos de uso personal como ser desodorantes, lociones, cremas, esmaltes etc. tambien vende golosinas en la Escuela “JOSE ANTONIO DOMINGUEZ” ubicada en la Aldea Jutiapa, Jamastran.
Doña Maria tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este negocio y cuando el periodo escolar termina se dedica a tiempo completo solo a la venta de cosméticos.  
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cosmeticos, desea tener variedad ya que la epoca de colegio ya comenzo y sus mayores clientes son los maestros, padres de familia y las mismas alumnas.
La Sra. S. esta casada, es madre de una hija y en estos momentos esta cursando sus estudios primarios.- su esposo es propietario de una unidad de transporte (TAXI) el cual genera buenos ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar.
juntos trabajan duro para salir adelante con su hija.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria S. is a merchant whose main business activity is selling personal use products such as deodorants, lotions, crèmes, nail polishes, and other items. She also sells candy at the Jose Antonio Dominguez School located in the neighborhood of Jutiapa, Jamastran.

Doña Maria has four years of experience working with her businesses. When the school year ends, she sells cosmetics on a full-time basis. This loan will be used to buy cosmetics because she wants to have more variety since the school year has started. Most of her customers are teachers, parents, and students.

Sra. S. is married and the mother of a daughter who is in elementary school. Her husband owns a taxi as a means of generating household income. Maria and her husband work very hard so that their daughter can get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase shampoos, hair conditioners, hair gels, crèmes, oils, lotions, perfumes, deodorants, lipsticks, facial moisturizers, and nail polishes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eannys

texts.es:
Eannys  Caceres  A.  está aplicando a su tercer credito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y a su segundo credikiva por eso está muy contenta,  porque fue mucho lo que compró por cuenta de este finanicamiento, entre  suelas, pegante cemento blanco, cintas, puntillas, tacones metálicos y plásticos, con los que  elaboró calzados artesanales femeninos que vendió a buen precio y le fue muy bien. Como necesita materias primas e insumo en general nuevamente, para responder a nuevos modelos carnavaleros y a solicitudes de clientes que le compran por docenas, está recurriendo nuevamente a un crédito, que augura tenga éxito porque producirá sobre pedidos de sus clientes. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus fondeadores: “Que Dios los bendiga por el apoyo incondicional que nos brindan para seguir adelante con los proyectos y sueños, pues gracias a ustedes se hacen posible.” 
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Eannys Caceres A. lo invitamos a que ingrese al siguiente enlace:  http:// kiva.org/lend/179645
texts.en:
Eannys Caceres A. is applying for her third loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which is her second through Kiva. She is very happy because with this financing she will be able to buy soles, white cement glue, ribbons, lace, metal heels, and plastic for producing handmade shoes. Eannys sells her products at a good price and is doing very well.

She needs to replenish her materials and supplies so that she can design new models for the Carnival season and fulfill the orders of her customers, who purchase by the dozen. Therefore, she is returning to request a new loan. Eannys predicts that she will be successful because the funds will help her produce the items required for her customers’ orders. She sends the following message to her lenders: “May God bless you for the unconditional support you have provided so that I can continue moving forward with my projects and dreams. Thank you for making this possible.”

To learn more about Eannys’ story, please click on the following link: http://www.kiva.org/lend/179645.

loans.use: Purchase soles, white cement glue, ribbons, lace, metal heels, and plastic

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is a special loan client with Esperanza and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. She lives in the town of Hato Mayor, an agricultural town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and one of their children.

Leonor is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her fruit and vegetables stall by purchasing different kind of fruit, beans, meat and vegetables. She also runs a "Fritura" - fried food stall, where she sells meat, plantains, etc. She will use the profits to save. She wants to have a better future, and she will save part of the profits long-term for that. Her most difficult challenge is to build her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: July

texts.es: July, es una mujer trabajadora de 26 años. Junto a su esposo Eloy y sus 2 hijos, viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en el caserío de San Juan la libertad. El trabajo al que se dedica está laboriosa mujer, es la “agricultura”, hace 5 años que comenzó alquilando un terreno agrícola de 2 hectáreas, pagando anualmente su alquiler. Con la adquisición de este terreno, inició la siembra de papa y arveja, los que  cuida, fertiliza y cultiva en compañía de su esposo. Los dos; vende lo cosechado en el mercado mayorista del lugar; pero las semillas de papa los comercializan en el mismo caserío. Ahora están trabajando arduamente para poder adquirir sus propios terrenos y así minimizar costos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “capital semillera”, y este es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una socia responsable. July, cosechará en los próximos meses varios sacos de papa; por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, para esparcirlos en sus terrenos agrícolas después de la cosecha.
texts.en:
July is a hardworking woman who is 26 years of age. She and her husband Eloy have two children. They live in a rented house located in the village of San Juan La Libertad. July works hard as a farmer. Five years ago, she started renting two hectares of farmland and continues to pay rent on an annual basis. With the acquisition of this land, she started planting potatoes and peas. She cares for, fertilizes, and cultivates her crops with her husband. The two of them sell their harvest at the local wholesale market. However, they sell potato seedlings in their village. Now they are working hard to acquire their own land so that they can minimize their costs.

July belongs to the Communal Bank “Capital Semillera” (Seed Capital). This is her tenth loan with MFP and she is a responsible member. Within the next few months, July will be harvesting several sacks of potatoes. For this reason, she will use this loan to buy two bags of seeds so that she begin planting peas on her land after this harvest.

loans.use: Purchase two bags of seeds for planting peas

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Mademoiselle  Akouwa   a 36  ans et mère  de  3  enfants.  Elle  habite  quartier Attiégou.  Elle fait  le commerce  de céréales pour  répondre aux besoins  de  ces  enfants.   Elle s’approvisionne  à  Anié en gros   et   revend  en  détail.   Elle  compte dans   cette  activité  6  ans  d’expérience.   Elle  demande  un  prêt  pour  acheter  3 sacs  de maïs, 3 sacs de mil et 2  sacs d’haricot.
texts.en: Akouwa is 36 years old and the mother of 3 children. She lives in the Attiegou quarter. She sells cereal grains in order to provide for her children's needs. She makes her purchases in wholesale at Anie and resells in retail. She has 6 years' experience in the field. She requests a loan to purchase 3 sacks of corn, 3 sacks of millet, and 2 sacks of beans.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Fátima

texts.es:
La señora Fátima G. Ortiz se dedica a la realización y venta de nacatamales comida típica a base de maíz y cerdo que se consume generalmente los fines de semana	 y cosa de horno postre a base de maíz desde hace dos años.
Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de cerdo y maíz.
texts.en:
Sra. Fátima G. Ortiz prepares and sells Nicaraguan tamales, a traditional dish made of corn and pork that is usually consumed on the weekends. She also makes baked desserts made of corn. Fátima has been in this business for two years.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of pork and corn.

loans.use: Purchase pork & corn

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
Jose F. es un joven barranquillero que vive en el barrio Santa Maria con su cónyuge,  quien se dedica a una actividad comercial, y sus tres hijos  que se encuentran en las edades  de diez, dos años y once meses;  allí  en esta comunidad tiene un negocio  de reciclaje llamado “Cacharrería la Bonga”  en el que trabaja,  mientras estudia su carrera de derecho  en la cual cursa  su quinto semestre en la universidad.   
José inició su negocio inició hace dos años y en la actualidad es muy reconocido en el gremio en el que se desenvuelve y esto es por su por su buen comportamiento mercadológico.  Este es el primer financiamiento que realiza a la Fundación Mario  Santo Domingo, con él comprará cobre que es su principal producto y que pronostica que su  inversión sea exitosa porque es el que   mayor  demanda  tiene. Su sueño es terminar su carrera universitaria y lograr ampliar su negocio para competir con los mayoristas, obtener mayores utilidades con el fin de cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Jose F. is a young man from Barranquilla who lives in the Santa Maria neighborhood with his partner who works in the commercial area, and his three children of ages ten years, two years, and eleven months. There in this community he has a recycling business called “Cacharrería la Bonga” (Bonga Hardware) where he works, as he continues studying for his career in law for which he is now in his fifth semester at the university.

Jose began his business two years ago and now is recognized througout the trade in which he operates because of his good marketing abilities. This is the first financing he has undertaken with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He will use it to buy copper, his main product. He predicts that his investment will be successful since it is the product with the greatest demand. 

His dream is to finish his university career and be able to expand his business in order to compete with the wholesalers and obtain better profits with the goal of realizing his dreams.

loans.use: He will buy copper, which is his main product

loans.name: Pabla Norma

texts.es: Pabla Norma tiene 65 años, su negocio que es la compra y venta de ropa Inició su negocio hace mas de 12 años, pues siempre le ha gustado salir adelante, esta es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que se siente muy contenta con este negocio. Inicio con esfuerzo propio ya que es una persona muy luchadora y siempre le ha gustado mantener a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de trajes, camisetas, ropa interior y pantalones. Ella siempre se ha caracterizado en ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en: Pabla Norma is 65 years old and has been in the business of buying and selling clothes for more than 12 years; she has always liked getting ahead.  This is her first loan and she is very happy with the financing.  She has made her own way and has always been a person that puts up a fight and likes to take care of her family.  The loan she is requesting is to purchase suits, shirts, undergarments, and pants.  She has been identified as always offering the best to her clients.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nubia Martiza

texts.es:
La Sra. Nubia M. tiene dos años de dedicarse al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de Ropa y calzado americano, actividad que realiza de manera domiciliar en la aldea de Jutiapa y caseríos cercanos al mismo.
Nubia a sabido ganarse la clientela, la prefieren por las facilidades de pago que les ofrece y por la buena calidad de productos que vende, ya que son de marcas reconocidas.
La Sra. Nubia utilizara el credito para la compra de ropa y calzado, sus clientes le están pidiendo encargos de uniformes escolares y zapatos, pero no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir su negocio y cubrir con la demanda que su clientela le esta exigiendo.
La Sra. Nubia M. vive en unión libre y junto a su compañero de hogar han procreado (2) hijos.
su marido tiene una barbería la cual opera bajo el nombre de barbería “Daguito”.
juntos trabajan fuerte para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nubia M. has been in business for 2 years and her primary activity is the sale of American brands of clothing and shoes.  She conducts business from home in the village of Jutiapa and other nearby villages.

Nubia has known how to win over clientele, she is pereferred due to the ease of her payment methods and for the good quality she offers; they are popular name brands.

Nubia will use the loan to purchase clothes and shoes.  Her clients are requesting school uniforms and shoes but she does not have the sufficient working capital to stock her business and cover the demand her clients are requesting of her.
Nubia M. lives in a common-law marriage with her partner and together they've procreated 2 children.  Her partner owns a barbershop which he operates under the name, "Daguito".  They work together to get their 2 children ahead and provide a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase clothes and shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana Maximina

texts.es: JUANA MAXIMINA tiene 35 años de edad es madre soltera con dos hijos de 12 años y uno  de 3 años de edad vive en casa  alquilada hace mas de 2 años se dedica a la venta de pollos hace mas de 10 años tiene un puesto en el mcdo la UNION que pronto sera utilizado para la venta de sus pollos, cuenta cuenta con buenas referencias personales y experiencia crediticia solicita dicho credito para gastos personales se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en: JUANA MAXIMINA, 35, is a single mother of two children who are 12 and 3 years of age living in a rented house.  For over two years she has been selling chicken.  She’s had a stand in the La Union Market for over 10 years that she will start to use to sell chicken soon.  She has good personal references and good credit history.   She is requesting this loan for personal expenses.  It is proposed due to her having ability to pay but above all the willingness to pay.

loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Akouvi  Vicé

texts.fr: Madame  Akouvi  est mariée et   a  4 enfants.  Elle  habite  quartier  Nukafu  et  est  âgée  de  39 ans.  Pour améliorer  les  conditions  de vie de ces enfants, elle  fait la  vente  de   beignets fris dans l'huile.  Elle a  commencé  en 2000 et  achète  les  ingrédients  au marché de  Nukafu où elle revend.  Elle sollicite un prêt  pour  acheter  2 sacs de  farine, 2  sacs de  sucre et 2 Bidons  d’huile. La dame en question est celle qui  est assise entrait de fris le beignet.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouvi, age 39, is married and has 4 children. She lives in the Nukafu neighborhood. To improve the standard of living of her children, she sells doughnuts fried in oil. She started this business in 2000, and buys her ingredients at the market in Nukafu, where she sells her doughnuts. She's seeking a loan to buy 2 sacks of flour, 2 sacks of sugar, and 2 cans of oil.

In the picture, she's the one sitting and frying doughnuts.

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of flour, 2 sacks of sugar, and 2 cans of oil.

loans.name: Santos Francisca

texts.es: Santos Francisca tiene 44 años, por lo que esta no es la primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos ya que los ha utilizado en su negocio. Ella se dedica a una panadería. Ella tiene 5 hijos pero solamente 3 están a su cargo. Con el paso del tiempo fue ampliando su inventario y fue realizando la elaboración de su delicioso pan, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre llegan en busca de la mejor calidad de pan. Actualmente Santos solicita este financiamiento para la compra de huevos, harina, mantequilla, queso, leña, bolsas entre otros productos. Ella sueña con que sus hijas logren finalizar sus estudios y sean personas de bien.
texts.en: Santos Francisca is 44 years old and this is not her first experience obtaining financing. She has applied them to her bakery business.  She has 5 children but only 3 are under her care.  As time has passed, she has expanded her inventory and has been baking her delicious bread.  The majority of her clients come in search of the best quality of bread.  Santos is requesting the loan to purchase: eggs, flour, butter, cheese, firewood,  and bags among other things.  She dreams of her daughters finishing school and becoming prosperous people.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito – Juli, departamento D. Puno, tiene 65 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.  Sabina no tiene estudios.
Es socia del Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace diez años, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que pudo utilizar en la compra D. redes para pescar. Sabina se dedica a la venta D. pescado como, pejerrey, carachi y mauri,  esta actividad la realiza en las diferentes ferias D. juli.  El que realiza la pesca es su esposo.
Con éste préstamo D. S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará redes y reemplazará las redes envejecidas para poder mejorar su pesca. En la fotografía se aprecia a la señora desenredando  una malla.
 La socia afirma que ya no tiene sueños por la edad avanzada en que se encuentra.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the communal bank, " Maria Asuncion Galindo";which is located in the district of Juli, a province of Chucuito-Juli, and in the Puno section. Sabina is 65 years old, married with 4 children, and has no formal education.

She has belong to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 10 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Nuevo Soles, a loan she was able to use to purchase fishing nets.  Sabina sells fish such as: silversiD., carachi, and marui which she sells at the various fairs in Juli.  Her husband is the one who actually does the fishing.
With this loan of 1000.00 Neuvo Soles, she will purchase nets to replace the old ones in order to improve her catch.  In the picture above, Sabina can be seen untangling a net.
Sabina affirms that at her age she no longer has any dreams.
What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of the loans and meeting with the members.

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary Luz V. de M.  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con sus tres  hijos en las edades de 17 a 29 años,  en un ambiente donde habitan muchos trabajadores independientes y coexisten negocios entre los que se cuenta las  variedades de  Mary Luz,  quien comercializa  en su punto de ventas cosméticos, fantasías y accesorios en general, además de generar otros ingresos provenientes de la preparación de fritos, actividad que realiza los fines de semana especialmente.   Mary Luz comenzó su actividad emprendedora desde hace diez años, cuando con un pequeño capital vendía a crédito    mercancía variada; ella buscando alternativas de rotar su dinero mas rápidamente , hace un año inició su venta  de fritos  actividad que desarrolla al frente de su casa.
Este es su tercer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará productos que tiene encargados y le garantizarán un desempeño exitoso de su inversión, como perfumes, labiales, polvos, desodorantes y accesorios femeninos e infantiles.
Desde que ingresó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo Mary Luz cuenta que está mucho mas flexible para hacer sus comprar y para recuperar su inversión, lo que la hace pagar sus cuotas a tiempo;  esto es porque ha aprendido  a hacer una buena selección de sus clientes, a quienes les responde de manera oportuna y efectiva.  Su gran desafío es tener su propia casa y ella  sabe que necesita seguir creciendo en su negocio para lograr este su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Mary Luz V. de M. lives in the city of Cartagena with her three children who are between the ages of 17 and 29.  It is an atmosphere where there are many independent workers with different businesses such as the one Mary Luz has.  She sells cosmetics and accessories and also earns an income selling fried foods, which she does especially on weekends.  Mary Luz began her business ten years ago by selling different products on a credit basis.  One year ago she started selling fried foods outside her home in order to take in more cash on a short term basis.

This is the third loan she has received from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and her first loan from Kiva.  She plans to use it to pay for the popular products she has already ordered to guarantee the success of her investment.  These are perfumes, lipsticks, powders, deodorants and women's and children's accessories.

Since she joined the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation Mary Luz says she has much more flexibility to make purchases and recover her investment so she can pay back the loan on time.  She learned how to select the right customers who respond to her by paying on time and efficiently.  Her main goal is to own her own home and she knows that in order to do this she has to continue growing her business.

loans.use: To buy perfume, lipstick, powders, deodorant and women's and children's accessories

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: Monsieur  Yaovi  est né à  Lomé et habite  quartier  Tokoin  Doumasséssé.  Il  a  37 ans.  Il est marié avec un enfant  en charge.  Il  vend  les produits génériques  pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins de sa  famille. Il a débuté   en  2009 et s’approvisionne  à Togo pharma.   Il revend  les  produits  dans  une boutique à  la devanture de sa maison.  Il demande un prêt  pour  acheter de nouveaux lots de produits  pour se réapprovisionner et satisfaire  plus de  clients.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaovi was born  in Lomé and lives in the Tokoin Doumasséssé neighborhood in Lomé. He's 37 years old, married, and has one child to support. To provide for his family, he sells generic drugs. He started in 2009, and gets his supplies from Togo Pharma.

He resells the drugs in a small shop in front of his house. He's seeking a loan to buy new batches of drugs to resupply his shop and meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy and resell generic drugs

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es: Hernando, de 25 años; es un hombre soltero y trabajador. Vive en compañía de su papá Heraclio y su mamá Sabina en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de San Juan de la libertad. La vida de este maravilloso joven se centra en el apoyo constante a sus padres a quienes quiere mucho. Hace 8 años que comenzó en el trabajo esforzado de la agricultura; en sus 3 hectáreas de terreno agrícola, siembra papa, arveja y habas, los que después de cuidarlos con el apoyo de sus padres; los comercializa en mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Según afirma, también se dedica en época de campaña a la venta de semillas. Viajando a la costa del país constantemente en esas fechas. Ahora sembrará papa de la variedad “canchan, única y perricholi”, por lo que espera mejorar la calidad de sus productos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “capital semillera”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es uno de los integrantes más jóvenes de la asociación. Hernando, se está preparando para la próxima campaña agrícola, por ello con el crédito comprará abono orgánico, guano de isla (fertilizante natural) y semillas de papa de la calidad primeriza para esparcirlos en estos meses.
texts.en:
