loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng P. lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province.  She is a married woman who was born in 1966. She  is a noodle seller in her local village, where she earns some money to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Noeun Chea, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where he cultivates rice to sell to support the family. This couple supports three children, who are all clothes sellers, earning small incomes.  

Mrs. Heng P. has a problem because her children’ work place is far away from her home.  To improve this condition, Mrs. Heng P. is applying for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her children's transportation. Her husband is present in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Fishing is the most important part of 35-year-old Soeurn S.’s daily work. He has been in the fishing business for more than two years. Besides this work, he plants rice crops each year with his wife. This family typically makes an average income of $5 per day to use for the family's expenses. 

Soeurn S. is looking for a loan as capital to support his farming business. He will use the loan to buy gasoline and fertilizer to help his crop grow well. Soeurn S. has two single children who are attending school. He and his wife are shown in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and fertilizer for rice farm

loans.name: Phoeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoeng S. is a widow living in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province.  She has three children --  one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are attending a local public school. 

Mrs. Phoeng S. is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family.  She is  also a Khmer cake maker.  At the present, she wants to start a new business but does not have the money.  To achieve this purpose, she is seeking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Benefrida

texts.en:
Benefrida A. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old. Benefrida is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Benefrida owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Benefrida has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,200 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Benefrida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benefrida is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Benefrida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her immediate family.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario P. is from the village of Turod, Quezon, Isabela. He is 28 years old. Mario is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mario owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mario has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Mario joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mario is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mario from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Mrs. Chuon S. M. owns a general store in her local village where she sells groceries to earn income to support her family.  She is also a pig breeder.   Her husband, Mr. Ry Som, is a rice wine maker and a farmer.  He owns a 2-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell to earn money to support his family. Through these activities, they support four children -- three of whom are students, and the youngest one is still only 4 years old. This family is living in Boeng Satong village in Takeo province.

Since her pig breeding business is going well, Mrs. Chuon S. M. wants to expand.   To achieve this purpose, she is requesting a loan to buy more sows and pig food.   

Her husband is present in the picture with her.

loans.use: To more pigs and pig food

loans.name: Chai

texts.en:
Mrs. Chai S. is a villager in Prey Dak Por village in Takeo province.  She was born in 1965. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Yoeun Nget, is a motorcycle taxi driver. This couple supports four children, who are seamstresses in garment factories. 

Although they work a lot, they can earn only a small income.  To improve this condition, Mrs. Chai S. is asking for a loan to buy two cows for breeding to start a new business. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Alvin John

texts.en:
Alvin John B. is from the village of Villa Fermin Echague. He is 19 years old. Alvin John is single. To make a living, Alvin John raises pigs for fattening and sale. Alvin John has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when he sells one of his raised pigs.

In 2011, Alvin John joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alvin John is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alvin John from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Mrs. Thim Y. lives in Prey Prum village in  Takeo province.  She was born in 1971. She is a pig breeder and a knitter.   Her husband, Mr. Sed Tang, is a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family. 

In the rice field, Mrs. Thim Y. has problems because their field has infertile soil, is located far away from the irrigation system, and has a lot of insects. To improve their rice production, she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, pesticides, and two water pumps. 

Mrs. Thim Y. is a mother of seven children  – one is employed in a garment factory, four are attending the local public school, and the rest are still too small to study or work. Her husband is present in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, pesticides, and two water pumps

loans.name: Li

texts.en: Li M., age 38, sells meatballs and grilled beef in front of her sister’s house in Phnom Penh City. Lim M. has been running this business since 2006, and makes an income of approximately $3.5 per day to help meet the needs of her family. Her husband is a motor taxi driver as well as a photographer. Her husband takes her to her selling place each day before he starts providing his taxi service. Unfortunately, his motorbike often breaks down during use. Because of that, Li M. has decided to seek a loan of $800 from Kiva to replace his broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To replace broken motorbike

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon P., 49, is married with four children living at home in the Takeo province. She grows rice and raises animals, typically making US$3 each day. Her husband is a local doctor who typically makes about US$5 each day. Thon P. would like a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a plot of land to resell when the price goes up.

loans.use: To purchase land to resell.

loans.name: Meakh

texts.en: Mrs. Meakh S. is a married woman who was born in 1982. She lives in Hang Heng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land for cultivating rice to sell to support her family. It is time to plow the rice field, but she does not have oxen for plowing. Therefore, Mrs. Meakh S. is applying for a loan to add to her savings to buy two oxen. Her husband, Mr. Bun Mol, is a motorcycle taxi driver who is able to earn some money to support the family, as well. This couple has two children: one is enrolled in a local public school and the youngest one is 1 years old.

loans.use: To buy two oxen for plowing

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van C., 25, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. C. and her husband are employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 2 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 35 on food and USD 37 on other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her family's use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Pom

texts.en: Pom B., 20, is married and lives with one young child in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$5 each day. Pom B. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer and a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Phen P., 37, resides with his family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. P. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.5 each per day. His wife is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 40 on the other necessary expenses. 

P. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to run a tailor shop for his wife. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To run a tailor shop for his wife.

loans.name: Mrs. Mey Sokhom Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of eight people who live in Kansaom Ak village in Takeo province. They will each use their portion of the loan in various ways to support their families. Mrs. Mey S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is a farm laborer and a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. She faces some obstacles because her field is infertile and it has a lot of insects. To improve rice production, Mrs. Mey S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. Her husband, Mr. Sokoeun Long, is a fisherman. They are supporting two children who are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Ngoeun's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of six people based in Angkor village, Takeo province. Mrs. Ngoeun S. is a group leader who has been selected by the other members. They will each use their portion of the loan in various ways to support their families. She was born in 1983. She and her husband, Mr. Ngoem You, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. He is also a construction worker. In the dry season, it is time for growing rice, so she needs some money to support this. To improve rice production, Mrs. Ngoeun S. is requesting a loan to support her farm. She is the mother of three children who are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To support her farming activities

loans.name: Lao

texts.en:
Lao H., 49, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. H. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 35 on food and USD 48 on other necessary expenses. 

H. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for her family's use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
Chen S., 31, resides with his family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. raises chickens to sell, earning an income of USD 1 each per day. His wife is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 25 on food and USD 37 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Gerelchuluun

texts.en:
Gerelchuluun, 29, is married and lives with her husband and daughter in Bayanhoshuu of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard. Her husband is self-employed and her daughter attends a local primary school. She began to sell clothes and other retail goods in 2008 with a working capital of 700,000 MNT. She operates a rented stall and her current working capital exceeds 1,500,000 MNT. 

Gerelchuluun is a hardworking and polite person who says, "I want to expand my business and increase my profit in order to buy land and build a house in the future." She is requesting a loan of 300,000 MNT to purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: From the province of Battambang, Lay N. is 40 years old, married and devoted to her five single children who are still living with her. She stays at home to manage the family housework. She also sells fruit to the villagers for income. She is married to 47-year-old Kao Sopheap, who helps support the family by working as a construction worker. Recently, the family's living conditions have not been comfortable because their house is getting old and it needs to be repaired. Therefore, Lay N. is asking for a loan to buy housing materials to repair her old house.

loans.use: To buy housing materials to repair her old house.

loans.name: Amarbayar

texts.en: Amarbayar, 23, is married and lives with her husband and three year old son in Hentii province of Mongolia. Her husband works for a construction company in the summer time and her son goes to kindergarden. Amarbayar has started a jewelery trading business in 2010. Now she operates a rented stall at a local trading center called Soyolj which is located in a busy street. She also has started a clothing trading business in addition to her jewelery trading business recently. She has been operating her business by bank loan and now her own working capital is increasing little by little. She is a hardworking and sociable person who says, "I like my business because as I am keen on making jewelery such as earrings, necklaces from different stones by myself. It is very interesting when you create different designs. I also have started clothing trading business recently in order to expand my business." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothing and jewelery for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing and jewelery.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin S., 45, is a construction worker building houses. He lives with his wife and four children in the Battambang province. He typically makes US$4 of profit a day, while his wife sells flowers and earns US$3 per day. Since Rin S. spends a lot on transportation, Rin S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
L. Ngô Thị (20211040008) is a 25-year-old female who lives in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Trà 1 - Nhóm 04 (nhóm 04).


L. is married and has 2 school-aged children. She operates a family member's business, manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members. L. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7.840.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.496.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital.  This will be her 4th loan from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nghiêm Thị P. (0) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị S. (0) is a 19-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị S. (0) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her recycling services.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Ngô Thị (20211040008) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Tiên Trà 1 - Nhóm 04 (nhóm 04).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các P. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa P..  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  S. hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 7.840.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nghiêm Thị P. (0) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


3.  Nguyễn Thị S. (0) là 19 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


4.  Nguyễn Thị S. (0) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
50-year-old Elena is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Elena also helps her husband till their rice farm. She shared that they are in need of farm inputs right now.

Elena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elena is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and feeds.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and feeds.

loans.name: Mes

texts.en:
Mes S. is 51 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the local busy market for more than ten years. She sells fish that she gets from her daughter who buys them from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. Mes S. is a widow; her husband died of illness years ago. Currently, she lives with her six children, four of whom are single while the other two are married and are starting to live in their own houses. She has three children who work as seamstresses in the garment industry. 

Mes S. uses her bicycle to pick up her fish every day. She says that it is hard for her to use her bicycle because it is so slow and it can’t transport her over long distances. To deal with this situation, she is applying for a loan to buy a used motorbike as a vehicle for picking up fish located far away. With the rest of the funds, she will buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike as a vehicle for picking up her fish in long way.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda T. is from the town of Surallah. She is 59 years old. Erlinda is married and has 8 children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice, vegetables and fruits for sale. Erlinda works hard for her chlildren. She said she wants to secure their future.

Erlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị (20211040054) is a 31-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. V. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Trà 1 - nhóm 09 (Nhóm 09).


V. is married and has 2 school-aged children. V. owns & operates a business, manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month.


V. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan from SEDA for the first time. She is requesting a loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support her livestock business.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Nhã (0) is a 20-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her livestock business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


V. Nguyễn Thị (20211040054) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở T. phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  V. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các T. viên.  Mặc dù mỗi T. viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các T. viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Tiên Trà 1 - nhóm 09 (Nhóm 09).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  V. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, V. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  V. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  V. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Nhã (0) là 20 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta M. is from the village of Lagag. She is 40 years old. Julieta is married and has three children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008 Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Julieta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel A. is a 41 year old man from the town of Surallah.  He is married and has five children between the ages of 18 and 3.  Joel owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of his income comes from planting and harvesting rice, fruit, and vegetables for sale.  Joel works hard to sustain his children's education because he wants all of them to finish college.

Joel joined Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), to access financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Joel has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  He is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP that will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Purevtsend

texts.en:
Purevtsend is a 40-year-old, married woman who lives with her husband and two children in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital of Mongolia.  They live in their own house on the outskirts of the city. Her husband is employed and her son attends college, while her daughter attends a local secondary school. 

In 2004, Purevtsend began her used clothing trading business.  She operates a rented stall at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Mongolia.  She is a hardworking person who says, "I work hard in order to save some money to afford my children's further studies."   She is requesting a loan of 400,000 MNT to purchase more used-clothing to trade.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing for trade

Lilibeth owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  Her main source of business income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale.  She also raises pigs in her backyard.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị (20211040023) is a 31-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. L. is the group leader of a 5-member group L. offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Trà 1 - nhóm 07 (nhóm 07).


L. is married and has 1 school-aged child. She owns & operates a business, manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month.


In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 2.016.000 VND from SEDA. This previous L. was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is now requesting a new L. of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product range. This will be her 4th L. from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô Thị P. (0) is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 4.704.000 VND L. to support her livestock business.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her livestock business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND L. to support her waste management business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND L. to support her manufacturing business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

loans.name: Elgrace

texts.en:
Elgrace G. is a 42-year-old women from Villa Fermin Echague village. She is married and has one school-aged child.  Elgrace owns and operates a general store.  Her business' main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elgrace has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Elgrace joined Kiva partner, Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI), to access financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan is Elgrace's first from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI):

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Roland Y. is a 32-year-old man from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is married with two school-aged children. Roland owns and operates a business in the service sector providing transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating jeep transportation in the local community. Roland has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Roland joined Kiva partner, Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI), to access financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He requests a 5000 PHP loan to repair his existing vehicle so he can provide better service. This is Roland's first loan request from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to support his family.

Rosalinda is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is a 59-year-old married woman with five adult children.  Rosalinda runs an agricultural business venture raising crops in the community.  Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for twenty years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

texts.ru: Хайдаров Абдурахим проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ему 37 лет. Он женат, имеет 4 детей. У него среднее образование. Он занимается животноводством. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Разводит скот у себя дома. В этой области уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Abdurahim H. lives in the J.Rumi region. He is 37 years old. He is married and has four children. He has secondary education. He has been doing animal husbandry and making a living by breeding large cattle. He does this at home. He has been in this business for six years. He needs the loan to buy large cattle.

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou T. is from the town of Surallah. She is 39 years old. Marilou is married and has five children. Her eldest child is 16 years old, while the youngest is only six. To make a living, Marilou raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marilou also owns and manages a sari-sari (general) store. She sells noodles, canned goods and other kinds of products. Marilou is thankful for her family's sources of income.

Marilou joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farming supplies.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina A. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Iligan City. She is 54 years old. Sabina is widowed and has seven adult children. To make a living Sabina owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling used clothing and shoe products (ukay-ukay). She also buys and sells assorted products such as toys, combs, needles and threads. Sabina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010 Sabina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sabina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Sabina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of used clothing. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Sabina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
56-year-old Visitacion lives in the town of Surallah with her familiy. She has three children aged 30, 20 and 16. Her 2 younger children go to school and Visitacion wishes for them to finish college and have bright futures.

Visitacion grows rice that she sells to her community. She tills her own land. She also has coconut trees planted on a part of her land. She makes copra out of the coconuts.

Visitacion is in need of fertilizers and seeds. She applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP which she will use to fund her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a cashew nut selling business for the past 10 years, selling at wholesale to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the dry hot season, the availability of cashew nuts is lower compared to during the rainy winter season. She hopes to establish a retail shop business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase five sacks of cashew nuts to sell. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Ma. Rosemie

texts.en:
Ma. Rosemie is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: charcoal sales and food production/sales. Her husband Edwin, who is 33 years old, works as a bus driver to earn his living.  They have three children who are between 5 and 9 years old. Ma. Rosemie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Rosemie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000 as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Ma. Rosemie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 49 years old. Evelyn is married and has 8 children. Six of her children still go to school. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Evelyn approximately earns 4000 PHP a month from farming. 

Evelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers and other farm inputs.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
Korn D., 29, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. D. is a tailor, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband sells used motorbikes, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 35 on the other necessary expenses. 

D. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new sewing machine to expand her current business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine to improve her business.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 38 year old lady and lives in the historic city of Pakistan, called Lahore. Lahore is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its culture tradition. She lives there in a small home, in the area of Ismail Nagar, with her family. She moved here 10 years ago. 

Sakina is the mother of 5 girls. Three of them are studying, while the others stay at home because they are too young to attend school. Her husband’s name is M. A. and he has an animal sales business. He buys young buffaloes and goats, raises them and sells for a profit to the required customers. 

Sakina, herself, is a housewife, prefers to stay at home and does her household responsibilities. In her spare time she also helps her husband by taking care of his animals, providing them timely food and water. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to expand his animal sales business. With the loan, he will buy animals (goats) that will help him increasing his sales and earns good profit. 

He is operating this business for past 10 years and Sakina is hopeful about the positive growth of his business after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats) for animal sales business.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 38 years old and still single. To make a living, Jimmy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jimmy is happy that because of his farm, he is able to help his family financially.

Jimmy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jimmy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jimmy is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch C. is highly expert at building stone and wooden houses in Kompong Tom province. He has a few laborers to help provide his service. Touch C. often gets a lot of orders from his clients to build houses. He has another partner in his wife who is a rice farmer. Touch C. has five children, two of whom are married and live independently while the other three are single and dependent on him. The couple has three kids who are employed in different jobs. Touch C. is going to use this loan to purchase a piece of land which is in a good location for farming. This is the reason why he is requesting a loan from Kiva through HKL.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim K., 48, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. K. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 11 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. 

K. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca R. is from the town of Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 61 years old. Rebecca is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Rebecca owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling personal products such as glasses and watches in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rebecca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Rebecca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz J. is from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Luz is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Luz owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish like sardines & mackerel in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Luz is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell like salmon and sardines. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.use: To open a retail shop, purchase rice, beans, and sugar, and open another water-selling stall.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda N. is from the village of Brgy. Sto. Domingo West, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old. Erlinda is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling charcoal to local businesses and community members. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. This loan will be Erlinda's second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Lorn T., 53, resides with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for it pre-Angkorean temples. T. is a tailor, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food, and USD 55 on other expenses. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a truck to provide services in transporting dirt to fill out the land. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a truck for transporting dirt.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 32 years old, married and supports her family by operating two business ventures:  soft drinks and water refilling.  She lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her soft drinks and water refilling businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,600. Elsie is borrowing PHP 15,000 to fund her business operations. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elsie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more softdrinks to sell

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:

Joel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI, and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and feeds. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for his children.

To make a living, Rodel owns & operates a motorcycle transport in the local community. Rodel is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to repair the vehicle he uses to operate his business. This loan will be his 4th loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a member of Unity Self-Help group under Faulu Kenya.  He joined the group so he can save money and access loans easily because the group members guarantee each other's loans.  

Joseph runs a green grocery to earn a living.  He also sells scrap metal and charcoal.  Previously, he worked as a welder for a living.  He hopes to expand his business to earn more income in the future.  

Joseph had previously serviced a loan from Faulu Kenya, and was able to improve his business with that loan.  He has requested another loan for  40,000 Kes to buy scrap metal and fruits.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals and fruits to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 50 years old. Mercedes is married and has 5 children. Four of her children are still going to school. To make a living, Mercedes plants and harvests rice for sale.  She also raises pigs for fattening and sale. Mercedes works hard to sustain her family, especially her children's education.

Mercedes joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI, and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase additional rice seeds, fertilizers and feeds.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and feeds

loans.name: Keth

texts.en:
Keth B. is 49 years old.  She resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, in an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. B. sells vegetables, earning an income of USD 1.3 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 2.3 per day. Each month, the family must spend USD 45 on food and USD 100 on the other necessary expenses. 

B. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase groceries to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has been operating a second-hand clothes selling business for the past two years, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells green vegetables to contribute to her income. 

Fatuma faces a major challenge in the difficulty of selling during the rainy season, when it is a challenge to sell door to door in bad weather. She hopes to establish a clothes selling stall in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 20,000, Fatuma wants to purchase four bundles of second hand clothes to resell. She decided to join after being introduced by friends who are already members of Yehu.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes to resell

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un S. is  27 years old.  She resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, in an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. is employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family must spend USD 66 on food and USD 50 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her family's use. In the future, she would like to use her income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Rubyrosa

To make a living, Rubyrosa owns & operates a business providing electronic loads and billiard playing to the local community. Rubyrosa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Rubyrosa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rubyrosa has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. That loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. 

Rubyrosa is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Saom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Saom S. is a group leader who has been selected by the four group members. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. They are based in Prey Phdau Cheung village, Takeo province. 

She owns a general store in the local village where she sells groceries to support her family. She also sells Khmer cake and soup. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. Mrs. Saom S. is, therefore, applying for a loan to buy more sticky-rice to make Khmer cakes. She is a widow with one child who helps in her business.

loans.use: To buy more sticky-rice to make Khmer cakes for selling

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 34 years old, married, and is a father of three children.  To earn a living, he makes and sells shoes.  In addition, he runs a kiosk for extra income.   He has been running the business for five years.  He hopes to open a shop to sell shoes mainly for school-going children.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, John has managed to increase his monthly income.  He dreams of making shoes in large numbers in five years.  He has requested a loan for 40,000 Kes to buy shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi S. is  45 years old.  She resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, in an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.  S. produces cow ties, earning an income of USD 2.3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 2.6 per day. Each month, the family must spend USD 50 on food and USD 100 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo makes a living growing rice. He tills his own land situated in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato and sells his harvest to his community. Nilo works hard to provide for his family. His 3 children go to school and he aims for them to finish college and have bright futures.

Nilo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilo has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lunh

texts.en: Lunh N. is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in the province of Kompomg Tom. To earn a living and support her family, she buys fish-paste in bulk, at low prices, from her wholesaler and then resells it at a profit. She has no life partner as her husband died many years ago. She is living in a wooden house with her son who is a blacksmith. Presently, Lunh N. is not happy, because her house needs to be repaired. She would like to ask for a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: buying and selling fruits and vegetables and a general store. Her husband Arsenio, who is 62 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have seven children who are between 19 and 38 years old. Sergia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sergia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,900 uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for future family needs and expansion of her businesses. Sergia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.Kiva.org

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school while two have already graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mariam has operated a business selling clothes from home for the past three years, selling to her neighbors, especially women. Mariam hopes to establish a clothes wholesale shop in the future. She plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of the simplicity of becoming a member.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale

loans.name: Nehemiah

texts.en: Nehemiah is a 24-year-old businessman who runs a retail shop. He is also employed as a driver. Nehemiah has been operating his business for two years. He decided to employ two people to run his business as he works as a driver. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to run his business well because he has been trained in business record keeping. He has requested a loan of 35,000 KES to buy a refrigerator, cooking fat, sugar and soap.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, cooking fat, sugar and soap

loans.name: Uong

texts.en: Uong D. has been in the farming business for years. He plants various crops and typically generates an income of $3 per day. His wife owns a small shop in Phnom Penh City where she sells many items such as soft drinks, food, plastic products, cooking ingredients and other necessary goods. She typically makes around US$5 in profit each day. She shares the financial responsibility with Uong D. to ensure their family has a comfortable life. The couple is blessed with two kids who are still enrolled in school. To encourage his wife, Uong D. will be using the loan he requested to enable his wife to accumulate a larger inventory of products to sell.

loans.use: To increase the store inventory

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie M. is from the village of Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Elsie owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling toys and accessories in the local community. She also makes and sells homemade ice cream. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional ingredients and increase working capital. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products, such as headbands and accessories. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
